How to Apply

  • Please gather the following materials in order to proceed with your application. You will not be able to save the application once you start. The deadline to submit your application is 11:59 pm ET on November 8, 2022.

title: Senior Consultant, Advanced Analytics
description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What you’ll be doing

Reporting to the Director, Advanced Analytics you will be a senior contributor to the delivery of the Data Analytics’ (DA) strategy, plan and projects within Internal Audit (IA). The Senior Consultant will work closely with the DA and IA teams to leverage analytics in order to provide assurance to the bank through our support of audit engagements, continuous monitoring and auditing programs, as well as proactive, strategic, and ad-hoc analysis of trending and emerging risks.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How you’ll succeed

  • Leverage advanced analytics, modeling, and statistical knowledge to design, implement, and deliver analytics engagements in support of Internal Audit partners. Actively lead assigned complex data analytics engagements to ensure quality, depth of analysis, and clearly communicated and insightful results.
  • Design and create interactive dashboards to support visual analytics projects and create continuous monitoring and auditing programs, data profiles and KPI/KRI dashboards.
  • Work closely with IA and other stakeholders to understand the controls environment of the bank, inherent and emerging risks, and scope of engagement for the deployment of data analytics.
  • Actively participate in the audit life-cycle activities; contribute as data & analytics Subject Matter Expert in scope and planning discussions, in designing and implementing the analytics engagement, and in delivery and presentation to stakeholders, including IA and Auditee executives.
  • Provide technical, motivational and strategic thought leadership to the Advanced Analytics team in planning and executing in-depth data analysis supporting a variety of audit activities.
  • Collaborate with other consultants and leaders in the CIBC analytics community to identify and realize points of integration to deliver coordinated analytics services to Internal Audit.

Who you are

  • A degree (preferably at the graduate level) in Management Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Quantitative Finance, Computer Science, or Business. Strategic and systematic thinker with a strong analytical and process development background.
  • 5+ years of experience and advanced practical and theoretical knowledge in data analytics, quantitative modeling, BI or statistical analysis
  • Progressive experience in the data analytics field including product, client or risk analytics. Prior experience in Assurance Analytics (Risk, Compliance, Audit) is a definite asset.
  • Great communication skills, verbal and written as well as a great storyteller who can visually bring to life what data and analytics is showing us.
  • Strong organization, leadership, and team-oriented skills. Demonstrated ability to collaborate as well as lead across a matrix organization to execute on priorities, influence change and deliver results.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of data analysis tools, languages, and methodologies. (SAS, Tableau, Python, Oracle RDBMS, Azure, Cloud Computing), knowledge of CIBC data sources, applications and system platforms is a benefit.

What CIBC offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 26th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Advanced Analytics, Business Analysis, Data Analysis, Data Analysis Tools, Financial Services, Statistics, Visual Analytics

title: Data Analyst, Rewards & Recognition
description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

The Data Analyst, Recognition provides data analytics support for multiple annual recognition programs and campaigns available to approximately 1,800 Sun Life Advisors.

Preferred skills

· Minimum 3 years\' experience in data analytics and business intelligence, including predictive analytics and data modeling.

· Degree in business administration, finance, economics, computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering, or equivalent is required.

· Experience building and maintaining Excel Macros and VBA programs.

· Experience using data analysis tools such as Microsoft SQL server or similar.

Qualifications

· Expert knowledge in the Microsoft suite of products (Excel, Word etc.) with proven experience with VBA, as well as advanced Excel functions

· Highly motivated individual who can execute independently with minimal direction

· Proficient in data investigation and compilation with multiple data sources

· Technical aptitude: ability to learn new tools and software quickly and understand technical concepts

· Strong analysis, investigative and problem-solving skills

· Innovative thinker; able to identify and champion proposals for approval

· Builds context by pushing beyond "how things are done" to understand "why" and uncover the underlying principles shaping the business

· Ability to extract, manipulate and simplify data through a variety of tools and techniques

· Process improvement skills with a demonstrated ability to produce meaningful results from data

· Strong communication and interpersonal skills; ability to explain business concepts to IT partners, and technical concepts to business partners

· Attention to detail and in-depth planning, organizational and time management skills

· Positive attitude to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and quickly find alternative solutions to challenges

· Flexibility: Ability to accept change, and adapt well to ambiguous situations

Responsibilities

· Lead incentive program modelling efforts by extracting data, analyzing, and drafting insights from previous programs; present proposals for future programs to the Recognition team and senior leadership for approval.

· Generate reports, develop, and maintain databases by acquiring data from various sources, build scripts that will make data evaluation process more flexible or scalable across data sets.

· Analyze and model data to showcase rich interactive visualizations to extract insights, to drive for strategic business decisions to drive performance.

· Adjust Excel VBA macros to include new requirements for annual programs, quarterly campaigns, and ad hoc incentives; ensuring data quality and timely delivery of the report.

· Work with the internal programming team to implement and test changes to automate Recognition program reporting.

· Support data and insights requests after each incentive program period to deliver the performance analysis and present them to the team and leadership.

· Support data warehousing in identifying and revising reporting requirements.

· Support ad hoc data and performance requests from leadership.

· Complete monthly, quarterly, annual program status reporting.

· Attend regular Recognition team meetings and provide data and insights in these meetings as required.

· Build new reports in Excel or Tableau as required to support the continuous improvement efforts of Recognition team.

· Ensure that business and technical requirements are captured in proper documentation and maintained.

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Salary Range:

51,100/51 100 - 82,800/82 800

Job Category:

Advanced Analytics

Posting End Date:

12/01/2023

title: Manager, Data Strategy - CID&A
description:
Requisition ID: 169773

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose

The Data Engineer, Strategic Project will be accountable for delivery of data analytics and business intelligence in support of strategic initiatives that go across different functions within Canadian Banking including Canadian Banking Analytics, Products, Market Research, Marketing, Customer Growth. Using analytics tools such as Python, SAS and Power BI, this role will access a wide range of sophisticated complex data sources to uncover insights in support of business initiatives and inquiries. The incumbent will work collaboratively with Data Enablement team to implement final data in the production for sharing with a wide audience.

Accountabilities

Accountability 1 – Data Analytics and Visualization


• Use a variety of Business Intelligence analytical and reporting tools (eg. SAS, SQL, Python, Power BI) to access Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW), Data Lake (EDL) and other platforms to perform complex analysis and reporting, including interactive dashboards, scorecard, regular reports, and ad-hoc requests as required.
• Lead the adoption of visualization tool such as Power BI as the primary delivery method to enable user interaction and data exploration by business partners.
• Provide dynamic reporting on key performance metrics to various stakeholders in retail, small business, product lines, channels, other strategic groups, and external stakeholders.
• Act as the advocate of CB Analytics to showcase analytics solutions and dashboards that helps business partners to gain insight, build business cases and make fact-based decisions
• Effectively manage and prioritize multiple business initiatives, projects and ad-hoc analysis with business stakeholders and possible external partners.

Accountability 2 – Processes Improvement


• Support migration of SAS based data processing workflows to Apache Spark & Python.
• Collaborate with analytics peers and data infrastructure groups across the bank on data initiatives such as platform migration and new data source ingestion and requirements for projects
• Build re-usable managed datasets for CBA stakeholders.
• Document existing processes and workflows, and look for opportunities to optimize and automate work stream
• Coach, assist and share knowledge and expertise to new and existing team members with varying degrees of technical and data expertise
• Learn new tools and technology to meet evolving business needs.

Accountability 3 – Business Impact


• Act as project owner in requirements gathering, program development and process automation to ensure high quality delivery.
• Champion a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge.
• Support the development and implementation of long-term data and analytics strategy that move towards high degree of automation and end-user self-help solutions
• Acquire and enhance knowledge in technical areas, product strategies, competitive practices, market insights to continuously improve analytics value
• Understand the Bank’s risk appetite and AML/ATF practices in day-to-day activities and decisions.
• Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct


Requirements & Qualifications

• Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics, or another quantitative field.
• 4+ years of experience in advanced analytics or data scientist role
• Must be proficient with Python (3+ years), PySpark, Spark, SAS, SQL, Power BI, Excel and MS Office
• Experience with Big Data ecosystem tools (e.g. Hadoop, Hive, Spark) and data processing within the EDL for ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures & data sets
• Experience with HDFS/Hive, MiniO/Presto/Trino, Airflow, Docker, Git would be an asset
• Experience with Google Cloud Platform (Google Cloud) would be an asset
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Must be able to interpret and consolidate large amount of information in actionable recommendations
• Must be flexible to adapt to a dynamic environment and make quick and sound decisions under pressure
• Must be reliable, pro-active, results-oriented, customer-focused, and attentive to details
• Must possess excellent time management and organizational skills
• Strong communication skills and relationship building skills with internal partners
• Strong prioritizing, planning, analytical, requirement gathering and presentation skills
• Open to learn new tools and explore new ways of analyzing data and business performance

Good to have Qualifications:


• 2+ years’ experience of banking and financial services products, covering all business lines (day-to-day, borrowing, investing, insurance, wealth management, and small business)

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Data Engineer Intern/Co-op
description:
Company Overview

All companies are not the same. What makes TD special as a business is also, what makes us special as an employer.

Why TD?

TD’s Colleague Promise: A better you. A better us.

A more confident you means a stronger us. We empower you to grow your skills, gain new perspectives, and create impact at work and in your community. That’s our unique and inclusive culture.

Department Overview

Co-op and Internship opportunities allow you to gain valuable work experience across several businesses at TD. You
will work with experienced colleagues, receive world class training, and be part of a community of students across
TD, where you will have an impact, grow as individual and experience our culture of care.

Our Co-op/Intern Programming is offered with select Co-op and Internship roles and is designed to help you better
understand the TD business, build on critical career capabilities, and broaden your professional network. This
program is designed to complement your on-the job experience and features:

  • Leadership talks with key Leaders from across the organization
  • Lunch and Learns on topics such as Innovation
  • Diversity and Inclusion and Personal Branding and so much more

Job Description

You will have the opportunity to work with one of our various teams within the Technology group, specifically working
on TD’s big data platform (Data-as-a-service or DaaS). Job responsibilities for a Data Engineer Intern/Co-op may
vary by area. They may include, but are not limited to the following:

  • Apply Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Project Management Methodology (PMLC) to complete specific development tasks for projects
  • Ensure defect-free programming by testing and debugging using available/appropriate tools and participate in reviewing peer coding
  • Design, develop and deploy system enhancements
  • Perform Unit and System Integration tests
  • Document system deployment plans for system implementation and code deployment
  • Participate in Proof-of-Concept (POC) on new technologies and document findings
  • Provide recommendations with full usability analysis
  • Perform root-cause analysis and resolution of application defects
  • Adhere to standard security coding practices to ensure application is free of coding vulnerabilities
  • Continuously enhance knowledge/expertise and keep current with leading-edge technologies trends/developments and develop expertise in TD services, applications, infrastructure, analytical tools and techniques that can contribute to effective solution development/delivery

Requirements

  • Currently enrolled in a relevant technology programs, such as Computer Science, Engineering, Information
  • Technology Management, Financial Analysis and Risk Management, Computing, etc.
  • Familiarity with at least one of the following technologies: Java, Scala, Python, Pyspark, or SQL
  • Practical experience/knowledge of data generation, data masking, data subsetting, data archiving, data virtualization, project management, management reporting, data modelling, and/or database development
  • Test Data Tools Knowledge (CA TDM or Delphix)
  • Familiarity with source code management such as GIT
  • Familiarity with Jira and Confluence
  • A thirst for constantly exploring emerging technology
  • Skills that would be an asset, but not required
    • Familiarity with RDBMS, Big data
    • Familiarity with Data Warehousing, ETL, ELT concepts
    • Familiarity with Pandas, Numpy Scikit-learn, Matplotlb, Ruby, Linux
    • Interest or aptitude in Financial Systems and the Financial Industry
    • Familiarity with Cloud technology (Azure, AWS, GCP)

Additional Information

Please note that this is a general posting. If you are selected for an interview, more information regarding
which business group and the specific job duties will be provided.

Early Talent Requirements

  • This position is a 4-month work term and will commence May 1 – August 25th, 2023.
  • Applications must include a resume (maximum of 2 pages). We welcome all applications; however, we will only contact qualified candidates chosen for an interview..
  • TD requires employees to reside in the country where the role is located, irrespective of remote working arrangements

Assigned Line of Business Requirements
Please note that the line of business that you are assigned to may require specific skills not mentioned in this posting

#P&TCo-op

Hours

37.5

Start Date

– Summer

Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Expert Data Engineering
description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Expert Data Engineering is responsible for building, managing, and optimizing data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers, shaping the enterprise Data as a Service (DaaS) model and delivering on IT business models. The Expert Data Engineering develops best practices and optimizes data pipelines to deliver products and services aligned with business expectations. The incumbent plays a pivotal role in operationalizing data and analytics initiatives, defining and building CN’s data integration and DaaS platform roadmap.

Main Responsibilities

Data Engineering

· Ensure optimal data delivery architecture and processes are consistent throughout ongoing projects

· Optimize CN’s data architecture to support the next generation of products and data initiatives

· Build, manage, and optimize data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers such as business or data analysts and data scientists

· Build data and domain event models, implement business rules, and engineer scalable data pipelines

· Ensure compliance with data governance and security requirements while creating, improving and operationalizing integrated and reusable data pipelines

· Enable faster data access, integrate data reuse, and improve time-to-solution for data and analytics initiatives

· Integrate analytics and data science results with business processes

· Promote effective data management practices

Data Design

· Collaborate with stakeholders and architects to model data landscape and define secure data exchange approaches

· Meet with stakeholders to identify fit-for-purpose within CN’s existing data ecosystem and deliver options and agile solutions

· Design and develop processing pipelines that ingest data into Data Hubs

· Expose the data into meaningful formats, like GraphQL

· Provide day-to-day support and technical expertise to both technical and non-technical teams

· Participate in building data engineering expertise and framework

· Translate business needs into technical requirements

Data Development

· Acquire, ingest and process data from multiple sources and systems

· Design and develop Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) pipelines using multiple sources of data in various formats

· Conduct metadata management, data cleansing and preparation

· Produce well documented quality codes

Data Operations - 10%

· Use Agile methodologies to streamline project delivery aligned with goals, timelines, and budget

· Build monitoring and debugging tools to analyze data pipelines

· Help unify software development and operations seamlessly, efficiently, and cost effectively

· Improve software quality, automate processes, and accelerate software releases

Data Quality Assurance

· Use Agile development practices for code reviews and testing to develop and deliver data pipelines

· Develop and implement test plans and scripts for various data quality processes

· Maintain manual and automated test scripts

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday and offers remote work.

Requirements

Experience

Data Engineering

· Minimum 5 years of experience in a data engineering role, working in different data management disciplines including data integration, modelling, optimization and quality

· Experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with business stakeholders in support of a departmental or multi-departmental data management and analytics initiative

· Experience with at least 2 of the following technologies: Python, Scala, SQL, Java

· Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Spark, etc.

· Experience with Cloud and non-Cloud based Hadoop ecosystem

· Experience with Cloud platforms such as Azure, Google Platform or Databricks

· Experience with traditional data warehousing and ETL tools (Informatica, Talend, Pentaho, DataStage)

· Experience with Linux and shell scripting

· Experience deploying applications into production environments such as code packaging, integration testing, monitoring and release management

· Experience with multiple database technologies such as Distributed Processing (Spark, Hadoop, EMR), traditional RDBMS (MS SQL Server, Oracle, DB2, MySQL, PostgreSQL), NoSQL (MongoDB, DynamoDB, Cassandra)

· Experience working in an Agile team environment

Education/Certification/Designation

· Bachelor\'s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Software Engineering

· Master’s Degree or PhD in Data Management, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related quantitative field*

· Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) Degree*

· Google or Azure Data Engineering certification*

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

Competencies

· Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing

· Ability to communicate complex solutions

· Applies analytical thinking

· Innovates through problem solving

· Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work

· Demonstrates organizational abilities and detail oriented

· Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity

· Works independently with little supervision

· Applies agile mindset

· Ability to work across structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data, extracting information and identifying linkages across disparate data sets

· Demonstrates commitment to high standards of ethics, regulatory compliance, customer service, and business integrity

Technical Skills/Knowledge

· Strong data analytics and development skills

· Demonstrated creativity skills

· Expertise in a combination of Scala, Java or Python

· Expertise with Big Data architecture and distributed computing processes and platforms such as Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Kafka, etc.

· Expertise with one or more SQL-on-Hadoop technology (Hive, Impala, Spark SQL, Presto)

· Knowledge of software engineering best practices such as code reviews, testing frameworks, maintainability and readability

· Expertise with GraphQL*

*Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

title: Technical Lead - ML Engineering - Natural Language Processing (Remote)
description:
We are looking for a Technical Lead - ML Engineering to join our growing R&D team! Reporting to the Engineering Manager, you will run our end-to-end machine learning platform, from research to production ML models. You are well-versed in the nuances of the machine learning lifecycle and have a clear approach to measuring the improvement of our ML systems and their peers' workflows. The technical lead role is a unique expansion of the scope of a Senior ML engineer that takes on multiple facets of technical leadership, team building, and building our technical roadmap. You can expect to collaborate with your ML teammates and folks from MLOps, Data, and Science teams.

BenchSci is a remote-first organization. At this moment, we are welcoming applicants from Canada, the US and the UK for this position.

You Will:

    • Design, build, evaluate and deploy robust, scalable, and production-ready ML models that enhance the speed and quality of life-saving research
    • Partner with the Engineering Manager and other Tech Leads to recruit and build the team
    • Lead or consult the authoring of engineering design proposals following the unified Platform Stream roadmap at BenchSci
    • Drive core components of our technical roadmap
    • Facilitate and make technical decisions in forums
    • Help define best practices based on personal industry experience and research across the Machine Learning team
    • Lead sprint planning, estimations, and code + design reviews
    • Oversee the solutions and long-term technology investments to inspire technical creativity at BenchSci

You Have:

    • 4+ years of experience working as a professional developer applying machine learning techniques to solve business problems
    • Experience with Python and programming fundamentals
    • Experience with NLP (ideally including NER) and PyTorch
    • Experience with designing, building, and evaluating scalable production-ready ML models
    • Experience with complex problem solving and an eye for details such as scalability and performance of a potential solution
    • Experience with data manipulation and processing, such as SQL or pandas
    • Experience with building functional, production-level models in the cloud
    • Experience with planning projects
    • A desire to see teammates succeed together
Benefits and Perks:
An engaging remote-first culture
A great compensation package that includes BenchSci equity options
15 days vacation plus an additional day every year; plus company closures for 15 more days throughout the year
Unlimited flex time for sick days, personal days, religious holidays
Comprehensive health and dental benefits Emphasis on mental health with $2500 CAD* for Psychologist, Social Worker, or Psychotherapist services
A $2000 CAD* Annual Learning & Development budget
A $1000 CAD* home office set-up budget
A $2500 CAD*wellness, lifestyle and productivity spending account for employees
Generous parental leave benefits with a top-up plan or paid time off options
*Benefits are tied to Canadian dollar amounts and would be converted to local currency for those in other countries. Moving to local currency allotments in the future.

About BenchSci:
BenchSci's vision is to help scientists bring novel medicine to patients 50% faster by 2025. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform.
Backed by F-Prime, Inovia, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at 16 top 20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading academic centers. We're a certified Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.

Our Culture:
BenchSci relentlessly builds on its strong foundation of culture. We put team members first, knowing that they're the organization's beating heart. We invest as much in our people as our products. Our culture fosters transparency, collaboration, and continuous learning.
We value each other's differences and always look for opportunities to embed equity into the fabric of our work. We foster diversity, autonomy, and personal growth, and provide resources to support motivated self-leaders in continuous improvement.
You will work with high-impact, highly skilled, and intelligent experts motivated to drive impact and fulfill a meaningful mission. We empower you to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and thrive. Here you will be challenged to stretch yourself to achieve the seemingly impossible. Learn more about our culture.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: We're committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. We believe that improving diversity, equity and inclusion is our collective responsibility, and this belief guides our DEI journey. Learn more about our DEI initiatives.

Accessibility Accommodations: Should you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. Please reach out to talent@benchsci.com.

#LI-Remote

title: Senior Manager, Data Ethics Design & Delivery
description:
Requisition ID: 169222

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose


The CIDA team at Scotiabank is at the forefront of the journey to transform the Bank into a data centric organization through a cloud-first strategy, well governed data and innovative analytics to deliver impactful customer insights. The award-winning Data Ethics & Use team, an integral part of CIDA, is helping to drive this transformation by helping the organization embed data ethics into the cultural fabric. The key focus areas are the way data is used, shared, and accessed at an enterprise level.
The Data Ethics & Use team is industry leading in the field of operationalizing the ethical use of data, including responsible AI. The aim is to provide transparent, robust, and ethical data practices across the enterprise to enhance the protection of our customers’ data, and the way we deliver business value. We are looking to build our delivery team with innovators, forward thinker, technically savvy agile leaders who will continue driving the advancement of data ethics.


The role of the Senior Manager, Design and Delivery, Data Ethics & Use will:


• Be the product owner for our Data Ethics & Use tools and technologies
• Be viewed as a leader for data ethics technology by key partners, including our Business, Analytics, Enablement, Architecture, Technology, Information Security, Privacy, Data and AI Risk, Legal, teams, etc to name a few
• Own the data ethics technical strategy and roadmap on an annual basis
• Lead definition, development, planning, execution, and implementation of industry leading data ethics tools and processes
• Enable the Bank’s adoption of the data ethics tools on a global scale (including International Banking)
• Lead a high-performance team, with focus on coaching and development


Key Responsibilities:


• Identify industry best practices to contribute to the design of the data ethics function to maintain the industry leading position Scotiabank holds as it pertains to data ethics
• Work closely with Governance and Operations Pillar and Education and Partnerships Pillar to create a comprehensive, holistic, sustainable and customer centric data ethics strategy, and the associated tools and processes that enable the delivery of that strategy
• Design (or contribute to the design) of data ethics tools and processes and related automation, including other enterprise tools and processes supporting the data ethics mandate; designs must be cloud compatible/scalable
• Liaise with Data Office, Enablement and Enterprise Technology teams to design, develop, and implement data ethics tools, including managing the delivery risk
• Work with various stakeholders in a matrix organization
• Manage the SCRUM process and Kanban board for the projects
• Create project plans, maintain JIRA board and Confluence, as needed
• Create acceptance criteria for features being released and perform UAT testing to ensure acceptance criteria are met
• Ensure timely delivery and successful adoption of data ethics tools and processes
• Work with the Education and Partnership team to design and deploy user interfaces to support successful delivery of automation and education-based tooling
• Design and deploy an analytics suite to support throughput optimization of data ethics processes by identifying and tracking slippage and anomalies in an automated fashion, working with the Governance and Operations team to incorporate requirements
• Review, address and incorporate user feedback into our tools and processes, as required
• Work with the Governance and Operations team to design solutions to mitigate pain points in operational throughput
• Create and update procedural artifacts to support the rollout and operationalization of data ethics tools and processes (Governance and Operations has accountability over the process)
• Provides advice, counsel, and process enhancements for Data & Analytics with respect to tools and procedures that incorporate the Data Ethics tools, for example, within Universal Catalogue
• Ensure consistency and alignment on best practices across the organization.
• Manage the enterprise data sensitivity dictionary and partner with internal stakeholders to ensure proper usage and timely updates
• Work closely with representatives across the bank to ensure all activities are conducted in compliance with internal policies & procedures and emerging governing regulations
• Develop strong working relationships with partners across the organization, to ensure consistency and alignment on best practices
• Review business stakeholders’ implementation of data ethics framework for quality assurance and compliance
• Track and report on process performance and adherence, identifying areas of improvement and recommending practical and innovative solutions
• Participate in planning and retrospective sessions, attend stand-ups, etc. - we work in an agile environment
• Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
• Lead a high-performance team-this is a people manager role where development and coaching is a focus
• Champion a high-performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment, communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team


Functional Competencies:


• 5+ years of experience in business/financial services; or a post-secondary education in computer sciences, programming, or a similar vocation
• Strong technical acumen
• Project management skills in order to handle diverse projects, often simultaneously, and meet aggressive deadlines
• Worked in (or at the very least has a very strong understanding of) agile and/or scrum
• A high level of interpersonal and presentation skills at all levels including the Executive Management Level
• Able to work in a matrixed organization that has multiple stakeholders
• Ability to present ideas and facilitate discussions to build consensus at all levels
• Strong communication skills, both written and spoken, and an ability to convey technical concepts into “layman terms”
• Results orientation and pragmatic approach to decision-making
• Ability to work independently and solve complex problems through a collaborative style
• Self-motivated, solution driven individual and adaptable to a fast-paced environment
• Ability to exercise good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions
• Ability to increase operating efficiency and produce high quality technical solutions
• Knowledge and understanding of data governance, data policy, privacy would be considered an asset
• Ability to drive success in a high performing, flexible and small team environment

title: Associate, Quantitative Rotational Program
description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Join our Quantitative Rotational Program as an Associate and make a real difference for our clients. This is a great opportunity to work under the leadership of our quantitative teams within Risk Management and Internal Audit. In the program, you will be provided with the opportunity to gain comprehensive experiences in developing, validating, implementing, managing and auditing various types of quantitative models. You’ll be part of a two-year program that consists of four, six-month rotations through various quantitative departments within CIBC that will provide you with the necessary experience and exposure to become an effective leader.

During your rotations, you will be part of the Quantitative Risk, Model Quantification and Model Validation within Risk Management, Model Risk teams within our Internal Audit department. Once you have successfully completed the program, you will be assisted in securing a full-time permanent role, preferably in one of the quantitative departments you worked with during your rotations. You will be part of a team that focuses on designing tools and reports to make the analysis process more efficient and streamlined. You’ll have an opportunity to prepare management summaries describing the mathematical analytics of models, validation techniques, test results, and model limitations, including recommendations for further improvements. You’ll perform, analyze and document the calibration and parametrization of the models used, define and monitor controls to ensure the appropriateness of the parameters used along with running back testing for models and analyze the impact of model behavior on risk management measures, as well as the impact of changes in capital from the model performance and how they affect the business.

As a QRP Associate, you will also have a chance to assist in the development and testing of new modelling methodologies, and effectively challenge these models through benchmark modelling and model validation. Additionally, we will look to you to provide assurance with respect to governance, the control environment, and compliance with regulatory requirements around model risk management through participating model specific and model governance audits and managing small and less complicated audit assignments and initiatives.

Important Information

  • You have a Master’s or Doctor’s degree in related programs e.g. Financial Engineering, Math, Physics and will graduate in 2023.
  • Please include your resume (no more than 2 pages), a cover letter (no more than 1 page), and your most recent unofficial transcript with your application. Please upload all documents as one PDF file into the Resume section of your application.
  • Work Location: Toronto (exact location to be decided during interview).
  • Duration of Program: 2 years (four, 6-month rotations).
  • Available start dates are in 2023 (to be confirmed during interview stage).
  • This job posting closes on February 5th at 11:59pm.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Project Management – You manage assignments through effective planning, execution, collaboration and communication to ensure timely delivery of high-quality results.
  • Risk Focused – You understand the importance of maintaining and evolving processes and control to mitigate model risks arising from an ever-changing business. You will also act as a champion for existing processes, working with key stakeholders and partners.
  • Communication and Relationship Management - You will build and develop relationships with key business contacts, governance functions and oversight groups to become a true partner to the business.
  • Passion – you will prove your risk focus and passion by demonstrating continuous improvement ideas that will enable CIBC’s model risk management practices to stand out in today’s competitive landscape.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in the use of mathematical, computer science, and statistical techniques, such as predictive modeling, analytics, and machine learning.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • Your attention to detail is second to none and you pick up things that others miss.
  • You enjoy finding innovative solutions to problems that will make a difference today and in the future.
  • You embrace change and look to evolve your thinking and the way you work to deliver your best.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive compensation, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 20th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Management Practices, Risk Management

title: Cloud Database Administrator
description:
Location: Ottawa, Canada

Thales people architect identity management and data protection solutions at the heart of digital security. Business and governments rely on us to bring trust to the billons of digital interactions they have with people. Our technologies and services help banks exchange funds, people cross borders, energy become smarter and much more. More than 30,000 organizations already rely on us to verify the identities of people and things, grant access to digital services, analyze vast quantities of information and encrypt data to make the connected world more secure.

We are currently recruiting for a talented Cloud Database Administrator to provide support of this complex state-of-art solution. This role will provide you with the opportunity to learn the latest IT solutions and security concepts, within a like-minded supportive talented team.

Thales offers global cloud-based authentication services for high-profile customers with the most versatile and highest security practices implemented. We provide identity and access management services to thousands of customers worldwide

Key Responsibility

  • Analyze product requirements and identify the best database solution, technology, and tool.
  • Ensure database consistency of the projects by resolving any constraints.
  • Develop database installation and upgrade script, which is part of CI/CD.
  • Provide workload estimation of customization, features, and component level.
  • Forecast, inform risk/concern on task, team, or project level, and propose mitigation plans.
  • Provide technical solutions, support, and perform several activities for a new or customized database of products/components used in the project which includes but is not limited to database design, installation, upgrade, migration, backup, recovery, failover, HA, hardening, monitoring, etc.
  • Review other DevOps code as necessary.
  • Orchestrate and optimize the database activities of several databases, schemas, and components in one project or solution.
  • Manage system/network configuration and monitoring.
  • Strategize and plan for data migration, and develop data migration script if required by the project.
  • Support, investigate and propose solutions/workarounds for production issues related to the database.
  • Provide documentation as appropriate including design documentation, comments in code, and end-user documentation
  • Consult with other technical team members and management on industry best practices.
  • Maintain and enhance internal tools
  • Provide input to improve the scalability and reliability of infrastructure to our Automation Architects
  • Deploy and assist with the maintenance of automation technologies
  • Participate in the on-call schedule & Provide L2/L3 Support to our Services desk and R&D teams
  • Document all build and run procedures when implementing new automation technologies.

Required Skills and Exerience

  • 5+ years experience in Cloud Native database technologies including RDS,MSSQL, CloudSQL, Cloud Spanner, etc.
  • 5+ years experience in deploying and supporting different flavors of Cloud and OnPrem databases including MSSQL, MySQL, Postgres, MongoDB, etc.
  • 5+ years must have experience with orchestration and Automations tools (Helmcharts, Ansible, Terraforms, Yaml, Python, Json)
  • 5+ years experience in SQL programming, bash scripting etc.
  • Experience in configuring and maintaining different database replication methodologies.
  • Strong interest in performance and security. Involvement in application server deployment including System setup, monitoring and Network configuration
  • Understanding of operational concepts like change management, on-call rotations, escalations, uptime, etc
  • Experience in managing production systems on a very large scale
  • Experience with security-relevant protocols
  • Deep understanding of one of the major OS families (Linux or Windows)
  • Adhere to security best practices from design to implementation and operations
  • Experience with PaaS technologies (K8s, OpenShift, etc.)
  • Experience with building pipelines for Infrastructure as a code using Terraform
  • Ability to work in an extremely geographically distributed company
  • Excellent communication skills across multiple mediums

Thales is an equal opportunity employer which values diversity and inclusivity in the workplace. Thales is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the interview process. Applicants selected for an interview who require accommodation are asked to advise accordingly upon the invitation for an interview. We will work with you to meet your needs. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

title: Business Insights & Analytics Associate (Undergraduate)
description:
Company Overview

All companies are not the same. What makes TD special as a business is also, what makes us special as an employer. Why TD?

TD’s Colleague Promise: A better you. A better us.

A more confident you means a stronger us. We empower you to grow your skills, gain new perspectives, and create impact at work and in your community. That’s our unique and inclusive culture.

Department Overview

Our Associate Programs offer new graduates experience within one TD’s many lines of business, and the chance to work alongside experienced colleagues, work on challenging projects and assignments, and receive coaching and mentorship from business leaders and the Early Talent Experience team, to set you up for success in your career at TD.

Associate Role Profile:

  • 1-year in-depth experience, complemented by programming, coaching, tools and support
  • This is a full-time, permanent position

In addition, as an Associate you have access to programming, tools and a community of support for your pursuits and interests beyond the 9-5. This includes leadership talks, lunch and learns, self-development workshops, TD sponsored conferences, socials, team challenges, volunteer opportunities, career coaching and more. You will be part of a cohort along with other TD Associates from across Canada! If one of our over 20+ Associate programs is of interest to you, please read on and apply today.

Job Description

The Data & Analytics Associate Program is a 1-year enhanced development opportunity in analytics and data. The Business Insights & Analytics Associate will perform a variety of activities, which may include:

  • Perform data queries and prepare data sets for analysis/modelling, including cleaning data and feature engineering
  • Analyze large data sets and identify trends and insights to inform business decisions; communicate findings to technical and non-technical audiences
  • Collaborate with team members and business partners to develop, test and deploy analytics solutions, for example: forecasting, optimization, or pricing models
  • Proactively identify business problems and opportunities where a data-driven solution would be appropriate and develop proposals / approaches
  • Collaborate with business partners to support the business case development process for analytics solutions

Requirements

  • JOB REQUIREMENTS
  • Must be graduated between May 2021 and May 2023 with an Undergraduate degree in Business, Management, and/or Data Analytics or related.
  • Strong statistical and analytical skills and interest are necessary.
  • Experience with analyzing large data sets, drawing insights and inferences, and communicating outputs.
  • Experienced in one or more of:
    • Big Data – Predictive Analytics, Optimization, Regression, Logit Modeling, Discreet Choice, Simulation, Propensity Modeling.
    • Machine Learning – Data/Text Mining, Programming, Algorithm Development, Automation Data Visualization, Natural Language Processing.
  • Strong technical knowledge and experience with at least one of: R, Python, SQL, SAS, Java, or C/C++
  • Technical knowledge or experience with Hadoop, Spark and Cloud.Experience with Data Management, and Project Management is a plus.

Must have strong leadership qualities including demonstrating initiative, establishing priorities and using strong communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to add value to each initiative, project or team assigned to. Able to participate as part of a team with targeted deliverables, working on initiatives designed to improve decisions, processes, systems, and applications which support our key businesses. Remain current with emerging trends and technologies in this field.

Additional Information

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

  • Application Deadline: February 5th, 2023
  • Anticipated Start Date: July 2023
  • Applications must include a transcript, cover letter (one letter-sized page or less) and a resume (maximum of 2 pages).
  • We welcome all applications; however, we will only contact qualified candidates chosen for an interview. Thank you for your interest.
  • TD requires employees to reside in the country where the role is located, irrespective of remote working arrangements
  • TD is committed to providing you with the best candidate experience in these unique circumstances. As such, work location and start dates are subject to change.
  • HOURS

    Monday-Friday, standard business hours.

    INCLUSIVENESS

    At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

37.5

Start Date

– Summer

We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Data Ethicist - REMOTE
description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together


The TELUS Data & Trust Office provides world-class, innovative privacy solutions to TELUS. We partner with teams across the organization to advance our corporate priorities, support innovation and ultimately deliver on our promise to safeguard our customers\' privacy and to earn and maintain their trust. As the Data Ethicist, reporting to the Director of Data Ethics & Governance, you will provide thought-leadership and work with a cross-functional group focused on enabling a framework for responsible use of data, including health data. You will guide the design and development of data research, data-driven products and services in accordance with ethical principles.


You will be a champion for data ethics across the organization and you will advocate for TELUS’ Trust Model as the fundamental driver for all of our decisions around data, recognizing how critical customer and team member trust is to TELUS’ mission. Your commitment to data ethics will support our business needs as well as our position on social capitalism as we seek opportunities to innovate with data, including health data, for social good and specifically to address some of society’s most pressing problems.


Here’s how

  • Provide ethical analysis and questioning for the implications of data use and technology evolution that is fair and transparent, considering the experience of a broad range of stakeholders to identify potential unintended consequences and impacts
  • Establish the data ethics framework to ensure there is understanding, consideration and foresight into the issues raised by previously unimaginable uses of data and the development of emerging technologies like AI
  • Enhance understanding of data ethics and its importance across TELUS, providing education and influencing the data user community and network of Data Stewards on responsible innovation
  • Work with TELUS engineers, researchers, designers and business stakeholders to embed ethical decision-making and risk mitigation and monitoring processes into emerging technology, ensuring that design and production is fit for purpose and beneficial
  • Maintain expert knowledge of data ethics toolkits, best practices and contribute to industry working groups on standards for data ethics and responsible innovation.
  • Define and oversee stakeholder engagement methods to incorporate participatory human-centered design and the consultation of diverse voices across the innovation lifecycle to enhance public understanding and improve the social impacts of technology
  • Learn continuously, innovate every day and seek opportunities to develop and demonstrate thought leadership with external stakeholders

Qualifications

What you bring

  • University degree or equivalent experience in applied ethics, philosophy, ethical machine learning, human-computer interaction, social and human sciences, or relevant fields
  • Valued for your knowledge and expertise in data ethics and ethical risk assessments of emerging technology
  • Experienced in establishing ethical decision-making and monitoring processes
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in conducting analysis around societal expectations, including identifying stakeholder values and defining techniques for engagement and input
  • Highly adaptable and comfortable working in a nascent field in a demanding and fast-paced environment
  • Able to identify and proactively consider opportunities outside of conventional thinking, providing multiple solutions to resolve problems and address gaps
  • Effective in written communication and verbally communicating progress on initiatives in leadership forums
  • Trusted as a collaborative partner with excellent interpersonal skills who will act with integrity and exemplify ethical practices to fulfill TELUS’ commitments to its customers
  • Post-secondary degree is a requirement


Great-to-haves

  • Bilingualism in English & French, verbal and/or written
  • Experience working in a large, matrixed organization
  • Experienced in implementing multidisciplinary data ethics practices and collaborating in a cross-functional environment working with technology, policy, engineering, product and research teams

title: Manager, Adjudication Data Analytics
description:
Requisition ID: 169306

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose of Job:

The Adjudication Management function is responsible for working with the Retail and Small Business risk adjudication teams (Loan Adjudication Centres & Loan Underwriting Centres) across the Caribbean region. This function is responsible to peform Data Analytics for the adjudication process considering Operations and Credit Risk.

Job Responsibilities:

The Manager, Adjudication Data Analytics C & CA will work closely with the Director Adjudication to ensure that all adjudication teams are aligned in terms of the risk policies and Bank’s Risk Appetite. Key accountabilities include:

• Develop reports using Data Analytics techniques for the adjudication centres to monitor operational KPIs, loan performance and exception management reporting

• Apply critical thinking to validate improvements with the adjudication units using data and analytics

• Manage analytical inquiries related to executive decisions and conducts root cause analysis of key operational issues, providing guidance and advice towards optimal resolution and mitigation while ensuring a timely and high-quality response.

• Responsible for monitoring the activity of the adjudication teams to provide risk oversight, including providing monthly analysis on early warning indicators, process updates, impact on adjudication from new initiatives or risk policies.

• Participating in key risk initiatives and projects which focus on the key priorities of the Adjudication teams from the data analytics perspective.

• Conducting assessments of the operational activity across the adjudication workflow. It is required that the Manager will provide recommendations for efficiency gains and be responsible for implementing these recommendations leveraging data and analytics.

• Assisting in the preparation of training material and tools for adjudicaiton teams, including communication of changes and updates.

• Working closely with the heads of the adjudication teams and Quality Assurance to identify areas where processes and procedures may need to be developed to improve the overall consistency of credit risk decisions.

• Adherence to lean practices and methodology

• Assist the Director with planning, forecasting, ad hoc requests, research, and strategic projects as they arise

• Responsible for quarterly Cost Allocation Transfer Pricing Expenses for the Adjudication department

• Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook, and the Guidelines for Business Conduct

• Champions a high-performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops, and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment, communicating vison/values/business strategy, and managing succession and development planning for the team

Job Requirements:

• Minimum bachelor's degree in business, economics, or finance or at least 3 year's working experience in retail banking or risk management
• Strong skills with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, SAS
• Experience on data analytics with a solid grasp of reporting practices and performance measurement tools
• Strong communication skills
• Strategic influencing abilities
• Assertive, and driven to be a change agent
• Fluent written and spoken English is mandatory
• Experience in Retail & Small Business banking, finance, credit risk are assets
• Spanish is an asset

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone.
