title: Software Engineer  ML Engine (Layer 6)
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

Layer 6 is a leading Canadian machine learning applied research company, a fully owned subsidiary of TD Bank Group. Layer 6 develops advanced machine learning and deep learning systems that have the power to uplift large populations while advancing the field of artificial intelligence. Our research is supported by access to massive datasets, close collaboration with world renowned academic faculty, and a uniquely scalable machine learning platform.

Our technical capabilities have been publicly recognized through a number of wins in various international machine learning competitions, including the prestigious ACM RecSys Challenge (the only repeat winner in 2017 and 2018 and runner-up in 2019), Google’s Landmark Retrieval Challenge (2nd place in 2018, 3rd place in 2019), the Stanford Question Answering Dataset (2nd place in 2019), 3rd YouTube-8M Video Understanding Challenge (winner in 2019) and Open Images 2019 – Visual Relationship (winner in 2019).

Job Description

The goal of the ML Engine team is to enable training and deploying robust and high-performing models by providing a solid foundation and allowing for fast iteration. We are looking for world-class engineers to take on the challenging problem of shipping core machine learning engine from 0 to 1. This Engine which will be used across the Bank. You will work with ML Product Engineers, Ops teams, and Research Scientist to ensure our framework can support use cases deployed on our computing infrastructure.

What are your main responsibilities?

  • Own and ship product features that enable ML engine capabilities
  • Work with product owners and tech leads to design, ship, and refine significant components of the product.
  • Work with research scientists and MLOps team to maintain service product.

Requirements

Must-Have:

  • Experience with building and scaling data-intensive software.
  • You value good software design and sweat over details in code and API design.
  • You enjoy learning new technology and also educating others.
  • You take great personal pride in building robust and scalable software.
  • You strive to communicate clearly and with empathy.
  • You are highly accountable and have a strong sense of ownership.
  • Ability to do detailed code reviews and give thoughtful feedback.

Nice to have

Experience building a library or a framework.
Experience with Big Data technologies and frameworks including but not limited to Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark, Cassandra, Kafka, Elasticsearch
Comfortable with statistics.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms.
Knowledge of distributed systems.

Additional Information

#LI-Hybrid

Hours

37.5

Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Senior Manager, Data Analytics & Reporting (FRC group)
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data.

The Business Intelligence group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization.

This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise.

Joining us in Business Intelligence & Reporting is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before.

Job Description

Senior Manager, Data Analytics & Reporting, Finance Risk Controls will be responsible for executing the detailed analytical work related to production of oversight and governance reporting, running monthly/quarterly completeness checks and managing dashboards within TD’s data environment and suite of tools (e.g., HIVE, PySpark, Tableau). The individual will support the team in strengthening of internal controls and enhancing governance and Quality Check (QC) program for financial controls across the Bank. The individual will support the team(s) in ensuring compliance with Finance policies and effectiveness of controls related to financial reporting.

Specific Functions and Accountabilities

  • Managing end-to-end production of reports and dashboards supporting FRC in its mandate of oversight certain Finance policies and financial reporting controls
  • Executing data pipeline and performing data engineering tasks using big data processing tools like HIVE, PySpark
  • Performing bug fixes and updating existing business logic based on business feedback.
  • Creating new metrics/tables and integrating them into the data pipeline on an ongoing basis
  • Running any manual processes to support production of dashboards, e.g., preparing files for data ingestion into TD’s analytics environment
  • Understanding metrics and validating those metrics with business partners, validating data quality for key performance metrics and performing root-cause analysis for any discrepancies noted, in alignment with relevant business partners
  • Gathering requirements for creation of new metrics and reports for dashboards arising from evolving needs
  • Collaborating with business partners in sourcing and maintaining reports and dashboard
  • Leading review and walkthrough sessions with various business and technology partners
  • Maintaining, prioritizing and implementing a feature backlog based on user feedback
  • Enhancements of reporting and dashboard design to optimize dashboard performance
  • Supporting management supervision and review, ongoing training needs, and change management.
  • Supporting dashboard user access management
  • Documenting and setting up of operating procedures to support dashboard implementation e.g., data lineage, metric formulation, data modelling, use cases, etc.
  • Preparing ad hoc reports and presentations, as required

Requirements

Specific Educational and Professional Experience Requirements:

  • University degree in business analytics or other relevant fields
  • 5+ years experience in data analytics, reporting and business intelligence roles
  • Strong knowledge of big data processing tools like, Hive and HQL/SQL, Python and PySpark to extract and transform data
  • Advance working knowledge of MS Excel, VBA and PowerPoint is highly preferred
  • Experience in an accounting/finance role (financial services industry desirable)
  • Internal controls experience will be an asset
  • Familiarity with TD businesses, technology, finance and data ecosystem will be an asset
  • Financial reporting, process, operations, internal controls, audit experiences will be an asset
Professional Skills and Competencies Requirements:

  • Excellent problem-solving skillsets with ability to interpret new business requirements, undertake deep-dive analysis and translate findings into actionable data insights
  • Ability to work with numbers, large data sets and their interpretation for business impact
  • Ability to make recommendations based on a combination of data, professional judgment and common sense
  • Ability to navigate some level of ambiguity and execute
  • Ability to synthesize data, extract meaning and utilize relevant information to identify opportunities and provide recommendations
  • Effective communication skills (both written and verbal), organizational and time-management skills
  • Good understanding of financial statement assertions and their practical application in controls

Additional Information

#LI-Hybrid
#FinanceCareers

Hours

37.5

Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Manager, Data Engineer
location: Canada : Ontario : Toronto || Canada : Ontario : North York
description:
Requisition ID: 185598

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose

Contributes to the overall success of the Global Operations Analytics department ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Responsible for supporting the end-to-end development and reporting lifecycle.

This includes sourcing the requisite data, delivering sound data solutions to enable reporting, and supporting the infrastructure/product portfolio. Ensures all activities conducted follow governing regulations, internal policies, and procedures

Accountabilities

  • Champions a customer-focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge.
  • Designs and maintains scalable data architecture in SQL Server (on-premise and Private Cloud) to support periodical integration, transformation, validation and analysis of financial/operational data from diverse sources. Ensures data architecture is maintained consistently with data management principles and continuously evolves in alignment with the strategic technology and governance standard
  • Work in an Agile environment, be quick to adapt and understand dynamic business requirements, and be able to work with tight timelines. Proactively supports data-based decision making across operational functions by identifying analytical prospects in operational/financial data.
  • Identify opportunities to automate business tasks that are manual/repetitive in nature and drives continuous improvement to key processes. Continuously cycles through the review and application of techniques, tools, and/or utilities to promote working standards and maintain high-quality solutions.
  • Executes all development phases supporting the end-to-end delivery of data solutions. Proficiently performs activities which include data profiling, acquisition, modeling, cleansing & conforming, augmentation with reference data, aggregation, and visualization; setting a solid foundation for on-line interactive dashboards and ad hoc reporting

  • Maintains availability, reliability, and integrity of data products by developing and/or configuring appropriate information controls. Builds strong relationships with enterprise architecture, infrastructure and technology teams to ensure that performance commitments to support business partners are fulfilled.

  • Executes data mining techniques to provide fact-based analysis to support data initiatives and improve business processes. Leverage agility and creativity to maximize value added by data analysis.

  • Proactively recommend and execute strategies to improve methodology, operational efficiency and effectiveness, and quality of deliverables. Continually identify, propose, and assist in the integration and adoption of new technologies and methodologies as appropriate.

  • Understands how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions. Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of the respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.

Dimensions

  • Data visualizations for Power BI reporting
  • Scope: Canadian Operations
  • Number of projects: ongoing complex reporting initiatives for the Canadian Business/Retail Service Centres
  • MS Azure Cloud Services implementation

Qualifications

  • University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Analytics, Mathematics, or related fields is required
  • University degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics or related fields
  • 7+ years of practical experience in business intelligence and data analytics is required
  • Advanced knowledge of database design, data mining, profiling and modelling techniques.
  • Solid experience with SQL Server, PEGA systems, developing Reporting Services (SSRS), building cubes using Analysis Services (SSAS), Dimensional/Relational modelling, and ETL
  • Experience integrating with Hadoop and working with Big Data technologies; Microsoft Visual Studio & Team Foundation Server
  • Experience with MS Azure Cloud Services (Implementation & Development)
  • Basic knowledge of Power BI and DAX coding
  • Experience with Python data libraries is an asset
  • Good communication skills are an asset
  • Familiarity of Commercial Banking products, services, policies and procedures, banking regulations and related regulatory requirements is an asset

Working Conditions

  • Work in a standard office-based environment; non-standard hours are a common occurrence.

title: Global Banking and Markets - COO Analyst - Summer 2024 - 12 month Intern/Co-op
description:
Requisition ID: 184249

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Term: May 2024 – April 2025

Application Deadline: 10/02/2023

There's no better way to kickstart your career than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! During your work term, you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love – all while getting paid to do it! There’s a place for every type of student at Scotiabank and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership and Opportunity).

Global Banking and Markets (GBM) provides corporate and institutional clients with lending and transaction services, investment banking, advice, and access to capital markets. GBM is a full-service wholesale bank in the Americas, with operations in 21 countries, serving clients across Canada, the United States, Latin America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific.

Client Insights and Analytics is part of the COO (Chief Operating Officer’s) office in Global Banking and Markets. Our mandate is to lead the execution of our business strategies through powerful reporting and analytics. We are closely integrated with our business partners to drive adoption, and client strategies/insights and opportunities.

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:

  • Assist our teams in report engineering, data analytics and data engineering and business relationship management.
  • Work with our relationship managers for business lines including Corporate & Investment Banking, Capital Markets, Global Business Payments and International Corporate and Commercial Banking.
  • Help leverage internal and external client data to facilitate opportunity identification.
  • Support adoption, change management and enhancement of our CRM (client relationship management) system.
  • Attend program meetings, and facilitate organization and follow-up as required.
  • Carry out ad-hoc projects and tasks as required.

Do you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if:

  • You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education.
  • You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.
  • You enjoy being involved in extracurricular activities such as conferences, clubs, and competitions/hackathons.
  • You are interested in or have knowledge of the capital markets and wholesale banking business.
  • You have experience working on a major project and/or initiative in a team.
  • You are comfortable dealing with ambiguity and a matrix-based environment.
  • You have excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • You have advanced experience with Excel.
  • You have considerable initiative, curiosity, creativity, and attention to detail.
  • You have a high level of energy, commitment, and a strong sense of teamwork.

What’s in it for you?

  • You’ll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team.
  • In-depth training to prepare you for the role, as well as ongoing coaching and feedback to help you succeed!
  • Exclusive student events such as Scotia Student Day, Lunch & Learns, leadership panels, and much more!
  • Bank-wide orientation to learn more about Scotiabank and gain exposure to senior leadership across the organization.
  • You will be provided with an excellent opportunity for learning and personal development, especially if you wish to gain exposure to global capital markets, and the critical real-time financial data needed and utilized to move key business lines forward.

How do I apply?

For students applying to our internship/co-op or new graduate programs, we do not require resumes! We believe in evaluating you through relationships over resumes and are focused on learning about who you are and what you’re interested in to uncover your true potential. Instead, we ask that as part of your application you complete the below:

  1. Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot.
  2. Complete a short one-way video interview here.
  3. Apply to the role and when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile.

*To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete all steps above.

title: Senior Data Engineer (13 month contract)
description:
As a key member of the Data & Advanced Analytics team, the role of Senior Data Engineer is instrumental in enhancing data & analytics capabilities by fostering industry standard processes and delivering high quality data assets to support investment decision making.

In this position, you will operationalize and maintain data pipelines deployed to the OMERS investment entities and nurture a business relationship that assists in meeting business demands. You will also support and collaborate with Power BI developers, data scientists and investment professionals and engage in technical support, research and integration through the implementation lifecycle of projects and solutions.

This role is accountable for ensuring that all projects, solutions and platforms align with and support overall enterprise Data & Technology strategy & goals, and enforce to company policies, industry standards and best practices.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

  • Deploying ETL pipelines to achieve a high level of reliability, scalability and security.
  • Designing and developing ETL pipelines to achieve a high level of reliability, scalability and security. Sourcing, transforming and delivering structured and unstructured assets for use in Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Factory, SQL Server, Azure Data Lake
  • Operating in an Agile development environment.
  • Communicating effectively with other engineers in the same team, with other teams and with various other partners such as product managers, data analysts and members of senior management.
  • Participating in solution build, delivery, support and solving
  • Leading change and communicating impacts to business partners and fellow team members
  • Exhibiting ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and ensure delivery on time, within scope and within budget
  • Participating in establishing sound data management practices for the team and the organization
  • Identifying, defining and implementing opportunities for enhancing existing processes
  • Defining and implementing technical test plans and perform unit and integration testing

To succeed in this role, you have:

  • Experience. 5+ years solving sophisticated technical data projects using the Microsoft Azure data stack is required
  • Industry Knowledge. The ability to quickly propose Azure Data Platform solutions by recalling the latest standard processes learned from MVP & Product Team articles, MSFT documentation, whitepapers, and community publications is required
  • Relationship Building. A proven track record of building deep technical relationships. Experience in setting expectations across various partners.
  • Problem-Solving. Must be able to trace data lineage / workflows and resolve technical issues with minimal supervision. Demonstrated proficiency in understanding and implementing business workflows is a plus.
  • Teamwork. Motivated and keen to work in a collaborative environment with a focus on team success over and above individual success.
  • Enterprise-scale technical experience with cloud and hybrid infrastructures, architecture designs, and technology management is required
  • Breadth of technical experience and knowledge across the Azure Data Platform, with depth Domain Expertise in two or more of the following Data Platform resources is required:
    • Azure Databricks using Python
    • Azure Functions v2/3 using C# or Python
    • Azure Machine Learning
  • Experience with on-premise SQL Server Data Tools
  • Experience developing star schema reporting pipelines using Kimball or Data Vault v2.0 methodologies

Education

  • Bachelor’s Degree in an appropriate field of study or equivalent work experience
  • Certifications in Azure Data Engineer and/or Azure DevOps Engineer Expert

Our story:

Founded in 1962, OMERS is one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, with $121 billion in net assets as at December 31, 2021. OMERS is a jointly-sponsored pension plan, with 1,000 participating employers ranging from large cities to local agencies, and over half a million active, deferred and retired members. OMERS members include union and non-union employees of municipalities, school boards, local boards, transit systems, electrical utilities, emergency services and children’s aid societies across Ontario. Contributions to the Plan are funded equally by members and employers. OMERS teams work in Toronto, London, New York, Amsterdam, Luxembourg, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe – serving members and employers and originating and managing a diversified portfolio of high-quality investments in public markets, private equity, infrastructure and real estate.

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

title: Researcher in Autonomous Transportation
description:
Thales people architect solutions that support 85 million mainline and

suburban passenger journeys, worldwide, every day. Our Rail Signalling

and Communication systems are used on metro lines across major cities,

and 72,000 kms of route, 52,000 trains per day in 16 countries are

controlled by our Traffic Management Systems. Together We deployed the

first-ever nationwide ticketing system which processes over 50 million

ticketing transactions in 100 cities daily.

Thales

provides world-leading Communications-Based Train Control (CBTC) and

interlocking for mass rail transit applications globally. The Centre of

Competence for Urban Rail Signalling is located right before you at

mid-town Toronto. As the largest office in Canada, we house a department

for every step of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)! This

includes Software, Hardware, Systems Design, Verification &

Validation, Operations, etc. The supporting corporate shared services

teams in Finance, Human Resources and IT is also located at the office.

Our office space was designed to provide a sustainable, healthy

workplace that expresses TRSS’s brand while increasing collaboration.

Features include Greenguard furniture, EnergyStar appliances,

low-emitting adhesives, sealants, and sliding glass doors on internal

offices provide daylight and views to the outside. Come join the big

Transport family, here in Toronto!

The primary responsibility of the Researcher in Autonomous Transportation is to lead the research and development of complex system using traditional and cutting-edge vision sensors (e.g., camera, LiDAR) as well as the supporting tools for Autonomous Transportation Solutions. The researcher must drive the design process of the systems or sub-systems that contain modules implementing algorithms within his/her established expertise in data analytics, computer vision, machine learning, control theory and artificial intelligence. The researcher must provide technical advice to R&T members and other departments regarding the latest scientific developments in the core areas autonomous transportations and supporting tools, identifying opportunities for new product offerings or enhanced functionality for enabling the Autonomous transportation product line. The researcher must design, implement and test the feasibility, robustness and performance of the solutions in order to meet the system design and safety requirements. The researcher must present written reports of the system performance evaluation to the R&T team as well as senior management stakeholders. Alongside these responsibilities and aligned with the natural progression of this role into technical management, the researcher must lead other team members supporting the development and implementation of the systems.

Key Job Functions:

  • Participate in the technical analysis and modelling of very complex, real-time, autonomous system use cases
  • Provide inputs to define system architecture and operation for new research concepts for application in urban rail solutions
  • Translate safety requirements for new autonomous transportation product offerings into test suites for the underlying machine vision, artificial intelligence, sensor fusion and adaptive control algorithms and their implementations
  • Oversee the design and implementation of prototype systems using computer vision and machine learning modules; manage the integration of software and hardware on experimental platforms
  • Support overall design solution to product definition including system architecture, failure mode analysis and system redundancy for R&T projects
  • Participate and provide inputs to the design and implementation of a set of progressively more complex ‘proof of concept’ platforms
  • Perform prototyping in simulation environments and with “proof of concept” platforms
  • Ensure that safety is built into the design by early identification of potential issues based both on the proposed system architecture and on its individual modules/functions.
  • Participate in ‘hands on’ development, integration, field testing and analysis of results
  • Work with multiple sensors and help develop the latest software algorithms to control complex, safety critical systems
  • Participate in the design, and review of test software applications required to support various R&T projects
  • Analyze and communicate results of simulations and/or experimental tests, formulating methodologies and developing tools as needed to collect, process, analyze and visualize large datasets
  • Prepare written and oral reports, following a sound, evidence-based methodology to analyze, solve, document and present proposed solutions to technical problems
  • Prepare and present reports to different stakeholders, from internal technical groups, senior management, clients and external collaborators
  • Write maintainable, reusable code, leveraging test-driven principles to develop high-quality computer vision and machine learning modules
  • Conduct code reviews for junior members of the team to ensure the highest code quality in computer vision and machine learning components
  • Act as a technical leader, internal consultant, and scientific liaison for autonomous transportation, keeping up to date with the latest scientific developments in the field, identifying opportunities for new product offerings or enhanced functionality, and conceiving, organizing and leading activities to communicate this knowledge to the R&T team
  • Act as a mentor and subject matter expert within the team and with other key stakeholders
  • Contribute to the development of strategic intellectual property for autonomous urban mobility, identifying and assessing innovation opportunities, and promoting an IP-focused development strategy among team
  • Provides technical support to product team and other departments as required to help with productization of new solutions
  • Prepare and review technical reports and provide findings and solutions to challenging research problems
  • Keep abreast of relevant technology developments in the industry and academia as related to R&T projects

Key Requirements:

  • A PhD or minimum of a Masters in Electrical & Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Robotics, Mechatronics, or a related field.
  • 4+ years of relevant work experience in the design, analysis, implementation and testing of autonomous transportation systems, at least 2 years non-concurrent with the PhD or Masters.
  • Expert-level knowledge and project-based experience in computer vision methods, such as 3D sensing, object detection, point cloud registration
  • Knowledge and project-based experience in machine learning and artificial intelligence methods
  • Ability to work comfortably with the mathematical and statistical theory, methods and computer implementations underpinning new product offerings for autonomous urban mobility
  • Proficiency in Python and C/C++, other languages are an asset
  • Knowledge of best practices in code development, documentation and version control
  • Knowledge and hands-on experience with ROS, QNX, and/or other software platforms for autonomous systems

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Ability to communicate effectively (both written and verbally) with team members, senior management, customers and external collaborators
  • Ability to work within a dynamic work environment, with changing priorities and deadlines

#LI-Hybrid

Thales is an equal opportunity employer which values diversity and inclusivity in the workplace. Thales is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the interview process. Applicants selected for an interview who require accommodation are asked to advise accordingly upon the invitation for an interview. We will work with you to meet your needs. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

title: Manager, Customer Intelligence
description:
Requisition ID: 172810

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose:


The Customer Analytics team of Tangerine is seeking a Manager, Customer Intelligence to support various business lines, including digital and innovation teams, in building exceptional customer experience and in growing their business portfolios through data and analytics-driven insights.
The incumbent contributes to the overall success of Tangerine by ensuring individual goals are executed and successfully delivered in support of the overall business targets and objectives. She/he also ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.

• Liaise directly with retail lending product teams to provide strategic analysis that will assist the business grow Tangerine’s customer base.

• Collaborate with Business Intelligence, Digital Analytics, Data Science and Marketing teams supporting initiatives to enhance campaign performance.
• Define and deliver campaign target lists for all campaigns related to retail lending products.

Education/Experience:

• Exceptional business planning, strategy development and execution skills

• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to explain data and findings to a non-technical and executive audience
• Demonstrated strong attention to detail, problem-solving, and critical thinking

title: Senior Campaign Data Analyst (Fixed term)
description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You\'ll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you\'ll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.

Job Description:

Role Summary

Join a team that is transforming data and analytics at Sun Life Financial (SLF) Canada. Sun Life’s Client Experience Office (CXO) Analytics area is aggressively enhancing its campaign design and data integration capability with new tools, and most importantly, new talent.

As a member of the CXO Analytics team, you will play a pivotal role in working closely with our business partners to enable digital engagement, understand our client needs in new ways, and ultimately enable a leading client experience.

As Senior Campaign Data Analyst, you will leverage our vast data, SAS and Big Data capabilities to enable these objectives by designing marketing campaigns and delivering data solutions for our inbound and outbound channels. In joining CXO Analytics, you will be part of one of the fastest growing areas of our business, representing the future of our business and our industry.

This is a fixed term position for 12 months. It offers partial benefits and 4 weeks vacation.

What will you do?

  • Plan, set up, and execute outbound and inbound digital campaigns and real time decision flows in accordance with the strategy and objectives of campaign stakeholders

  • Work in partnership with internal stakeholders to leverage personas, customer journeys and data strategies to develop and implement marketing automation programs

  • Gather, document, and help form business requirements, key performance indicators, and other functional and technical requirements

  • Create high quality client experience through use of digital channels, interactive journeys and triggered engagements

  • Support stakeholders and third parties throughout the campaign implementation process

  • Interact frequently with stakeholders including interaction with marketers, analysts, web developers, content and creative designers

  • Work with a small number of data analysts, data engineers, data scientists to deliver on projects and initiatives that are fairly complex.

  • Manage multiple campaigns simultaneously

  • Perform extensive data profiling and develop deep understanding of the highly complex data landscape.

  • Deepen the organizations understanding of client and member level data and provide expert guidance on how best to leverage data to provide actionable business insight

  • Manage and execute on business data requests ensuring requests are aligned to business priorities and the request fulfillment meets the business needs

  • Collaborates in an agile team to understand business objectives and develop campaign solutions that deliver best in class, engaging and highly relevant experiences

  • Liaise with stakeholders across other teams to resolve discrepancies

  • Manage and execute data requests ensuring requests are aligned to business priorities and the request fulfillment meets the business needs

  • Support campaign target list generation, analyses, measurement and reporting

What will you need to succeed?

  • Bachelor’s degree in a field with a strong technical core such as Computer Science, Software engineering, Business Analytics, Engineering Science, Statistics, Math, Business Commerce or equivalent working experience

  • Over 4 years experience in campaign design, data management and a solid understanding of the data needs of marketing, campaigns and business.

  • 3+ years experience in data analytical role: Analytical programming languages (e.g., SAS, SQL, Python).

  • Strong curiosity and drive for learning (formal & informal) to develop technical skills and awareness of business issues.

  • Excellent communication skills (both written and oral), combined with strong interpersonal and organizational skills.

  • The candidates must have relevant experience in the following areas:

    • Knowledge of Inbound and Outbound campaigns

    • Knowledge on the data needs for analytics and campaigns

    • Communication and liaison experience between business, analytics and IT

Unique Requirements

  • The candidate selected for this role is required to attain Canadian Reliability Security Clearance (administered by submitting fingerprints to the RCMP, who then conduct min. 5 year history checks)

  • To see if you are eligible for this clearance, please review the section 201 on the Federal Government site (https://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/esc-src/personnel/pdcf-rsrp-eng.html)

What will be nice to have?

  • Related work experience in Campaign execution and operations, marketing automation, digital communications, database marketing and data analysis, decision engines (e.g. SAS RTDM)

  • General programming language knowledge and basic application design

  • Some technical writing, report analysis and PowerPoint presentation creation

What\'s In It For You?

  • Great Place to Work® Certified in Canada and the US - 2022

  • Great Place to Work® award for Best Workplaces for #HybridWork - 2022

  • Named “Best Places to Work” by Glassdoor - 2021

  • Canada Award for Excellence for Mental Health at Work - 2021

  • Flex hours and Flexible hybrid work model including in-country work-from-home if you prefer. #LI-Hybrid # LI- Remote

  • Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data

  • Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security

  • A friendly, collaborative, and inclusive culture

  • Be part of our continuous improvement journey in developing the next greatest digital enterprise experience.

  • Work and professional development that is united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives

  • A common sense dress code, where you decide how you dress based on your day

  • The opportunity to move along a variety of career paths with amazing networking potential

The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.

At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.

We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

74,100/74 100 - 120,800/120 800

Advanced Analytics

12/03/2023

title: Senior Data Scientist, Banking & Accounting
description:
About the role

Shopify is the world\'s first \'retail operating system\'. It has evolved over 17 years of making commerce better for everyone. Leveraging our data has always been essential to this mission. Our Financial Services are powered by algorithms that benefit merchants, not just through their data, but through the entire history of commerce on Shopify.

The Banking and Accounting team builds products to extend the financial capabilities for small and medium-sized businesses. It is a cross-functional team with data scientists, engineering, design, and product sitting collectively at the table.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you’ll help build future financial products used by millions of Shopify merchants, collaborating with technical and non-technical stakeholders across the company. You’ll mentor other data scientists and operate as a technical guide for the team. If you enjoy working in financial services and building greenfield products, this role is for you.


Qualifications

You will need to have:

  • Extensive experience using Python including a strong grasp of object oriented programming (OOP) fundamentals
  • Deep understanding of advanced SQL techniques
  • Proven expertise in designing and running experiments, and a track record of more advanced testing methods beyond A/B Testing
  • Experience building data pipelines and driving ETL design decisions
  • Experience building machine learning models (e.g. propensity models, recommendation system, risk, credit and trust models)
  • Proven track record creating data product strategies, shipping data products, iterating after launch, and trying again
  • Strong ability to prioritize and communicate to technical and non-technical audiences alike
  • Experience with leading projects and mentoring other data scientists

It would be great if you have:

  • Experience working with commercial organizations (e.g. Sales, Marketing, Account Management, Risk Management, Support)
  • Experience working at a fintech company or financial services company
  • Experience setting up experiments in commercial organizations
  • Previous experience working at a large technology company

We know that looking for a new role can be both exciting and time-consuming, and we truly appreciate your effort.

title: Intern, Quality and Analysis – Asset Planning and Quality
description:
At CN, everydaybrings new and exciting challenges. You can expect an interesting environmentwhere you’re part of making sure ourbusiness is running optimally and safely―helping keep the economy on track. We welcome students who share theirideas, perspectives and understanding of newtechnologies withour teams. In return, we provide the opportunity towork on exciting projects with experienced collaborators who are happy to share their knowledge, all within a mutually-agreed to framework. Youwill be able to thrive in our close-knit, safety-focused culture workingtogether as ONE TEAM. The opportunities we offer are meaningful because thework we do matters. Join us!

Canadian National Railway Company (CN) is looking for a highly motivated person to fulfill a full-time (40h/week) Intern, Quality and Analysis – Asset Planning and Quality position in Edmonton, AB for summer 2023 (May – August).

Job Summary

The Intern, Quality and Analysis – Asset Planning and Quality is responsible for developing an understanding of techniques used in the rail and logistics sector, in order to leverage large datasets, to provide insights for operations planning, and to develop tools and reports for Network Operations and Planning and other teams. The role reports directly with the Manager, Quality and Analysis, and works independently and provides daily or weekly reports on the progress and the challenges incurred.

Major Responsibilities

Create Next Generation analytic tool for CN Key Operating Metrics

  • Use the current Morning Network Overview (MNO) report as the base to be enhanced
  • Create a next generation tool that replicates the delivery of CN’s key metrics in a more interactive and intuitive manner
  • Create and maintain an updated catalogue of CN’s Key Metrics Library that provides more information on data mining for ad-hoc users (e.g. provide Structured Query Language (SQL) sample code to extract the base data for each measure, develop and implement a more effective method to update and maintain metadata)
  • Respond to any inquisitions on data irregularities or requests

Develop an Operating Metrics Trend Analysis and Forecaster

  • Utilize data mining techniques to gather pertinent data for analysis
  • Perform statistical analysis on historical data to determine any correlations between CN’s forecast files and historical performance metrics
  • Develop a process to forecast certain metrics based on CN’s Revenue Forecast
  • Determine relationships between operating performance metrics through statistical analysis
  • Leverage relational databases and write SQL to prepare data
  • Communicate insights using visualization and reporting software (e.g. Tableau)

Enhance Internal Operating Metrics in SharePoint

  • Maintain the catalogue of Operating Metrics reports and tools in SharePoint
  • Collaborate with stakeholders on the utility of reports, refine, and decommission
  • Develop the metadata to guide users to helpful resources and evangelize the tool

Requirements

  • Strong knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL), and Database fundamentals
  • Knowledge of statistics, analytical methods, software development and programming

Education

  • Working towards a Bachelor’s Degree in Computing Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Data Science, Statistics or similar discipline (minimum of 2 years completed)


About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

title: Student, GIS Data & Analytics (Summer 2023, 4 Months)
description:
Why join us?

Are you looking to join an innovative, global real estate company who builds communities and connects people to exceptional places? If so, we would love to tell you our story.

At Oxford, our culture is truly one of a kind. Across business lines and around the world, we embrace the complex and tackle opportunities with speed and agility. We are ambitious and humble, forward looking and service-focused. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live. We believe that what is good for the environment is good for business. Together we deliver exceptional experiences to our over 2 million daily customers.

We are looking for a highly motivated, detail-oriented GIS data & analytics Co-op to join our National Strategic Marketing team to support entire Oxford Retail Portfolio in using geographic data and technology to make informed decisions and drive business results. Our primary focus is to provide actionable insights to retail business using data alongside traditional and non-traditional research. The position is an essential part of Strategic Marketing team at Oxford as you will have opportunity to help us change the landscape of commercial Retail. The Co-op will be an integral member of Advanced Analytics and Research team and be responsible for a wide range of activities across the Retail sector with opportunity to apply GIS knowledge on every aspect of Oxford Retail.

As a member of this team, you will be responsible for:

  • Leverage geographic data and research to support the development of strategies and objectives by channel, business unit, and brands
  • Build trade area maps of different Oxford properties and conduct data driven research to optimize the retail operations using GIS software
  • Collect data on consumers, competitors, and marketplace; consolidate data into actionable insights
  • Work with different retail stakeholders to understand their needs and build dashboards, reports to help them achieve their goals
  • Work with team to innovate and build reports, dashboards, and other data products using (both geographic and other data sources) to enhance decision making and daily operations across different retail assets
  • Conduct customer surveys to build customer profile, understand customer needs and sentiments
  • Optional- opportunity to shadow data scientists to learn how to build customer segments and build predictive models to optimize operations

To succeed in this role, you are:

  • Working towards completion of an undergraduate degree (preferably with a targeted graduation date in 2024) with a concentration in GIS or other similar disciplines
  • Working knowledge of GIS software like Arc GIS
  • Working knowledge of geographic and demographic data is required
  • Working knowledge of creating dashboards using Tableau & Power Bi
  • Self-motivated individual with a strong work ethic and a high level of attention to detail
  • Ability to communicate clearly, concisely, and accurately (both verbal and written)
  • Ability to meet tight deadlines and to manage conflicting priorities
  • Excellent interpersonal skills

Our story:

Oxford Properties Group (“Oxford”) is a leading global real estate investor, asset manager and business builder. It builds, buys and grows defined real estate operating business with world-class management teams. Established in 1960, Oxford and its portfolio companies manage approximately C$70 billion of assets across four continents on behalf of their investment partners. Oxford’s owned portfolio encompasses office, logistics, retail, multifamily residential, life sciences and hotels; it spans more than 150 million square feet in global gateway cities and high-growth hubs. A thematic investor with a committed source of capital, Oxford invests in properties, portfolios, development sites, debt, securities and real estate businesses across the risk-reward spectrum. Together with its portfolio companies, Oxford is one of the world’s most active developers with over 100 projects currently underway globally across all major asset classes. Oxford is owned by OMERS, the Canadian defined benefit pension plan for Ontario\'s municipal employees.

For more information on Oxford, visit www.oxfordproperties.com

OMERS is committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities in which we live and work. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a barrier-free recruitment and selection process. At OMERS inclusion and diversity means belonging. How we create a sense of belonging is through our employees and our vast network of Employee Resource Groups. Whether you are passionate about gender, pride, or visible minorities, we have groups that are focused on making a difference in all of our lives.

title: Business Application Analyst III
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

Business Application Ownership and Management at TD is part of an enterprise-wide data and analytics ecosystem. We strive to be the better bank, and in this role, we’ll count on you to be our interface between business and technology.

We’re looking for highly analytical, collaborative and agile professionals who can merge and translate data to build business momentum and deliver results.

Using professional and experiential knowledge, the Business Application Ownership and Management team works in close partnership with corporate functions and technology, as well as aligns to project management, business analysis, business management, strategy and governance.

If you get business application management, its potential and power, we think you’ll love working with like-minded and innovative experts at TD, where you can help drive the business forward and take your own career to new heights.

Job Description

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
CUSTOMER

  • Responsible for intake of projects and major initiatives
  • Responsible for the documentation of all business owned artifacts that are required for projects and major initiatives as defined by the bank’s Project Delivery Life Cycle (PDLC) methodology
  • Responsible for business process documentation for all business applications owned/managed
  • Responsible for day to day operations process management to ensure consistency, and delivery according to established SLA
  • Responsible for all Business Acceptance Test (BAT) documentation that is required for all projects and major initiatives as defined by the bank’s project delivery methodology
  • Responsible for the execution of all BAT testing for projects and/or release maintenances
  • Responsible for working with Technology to establish a partnership and ensure all business requirements and Data Governance requirements are met
  • Provide support on deployment and change management for initiatives relating to applications owned / managed
  • Review requirements specifications to provide timely and meaningful feedback
  • Provide feedback and thoughts on possible solutions to issues/risks arising throughout the life cycle of a project, including adherence to enterprise application / data lifecycle practices
  • Identify and escalate risks that could impact project timelines or the quality of the deliverables to project manager and business owner, provide options and recommendation
  • Act as an escalation point for application and operation issues both directly and through internal/external business partners (including external vendors)
  • May provide project management support to various extents

SHAREHOLDER

  • Act as a decision maker on projects within scope—responsible for getting input from the appropriate SMEs in order to make decisions
  • Accountable for adhering to the EPMO project management methodology
  • Ensure adherence to the Data Governance Framework
  • Ensure adherence to guidelines and regulatory requirements under Privacy, Legal, Compliance, and the Office of the Chief Data Officer
  • Demonstrated ability to build relationships within the team and with key stakeholders
  • Continuously enhance knowledge/expertise in own area and keep current with leading-edge technologies trends/developments
  • Continuously enhance knowledge of business domains and their products/services
  • Support the development of business cases including benefits identification
  • Support and/or implement solutions that mitigate risk and maximizes the availability of service, efficiency and effectiveness

EMPLOYEE / TEAM

  • Participate fully as a member of the team, support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation and teamwork and ensure timely communication of issues/ points of interest
  • Support the team by continuously enhancing knowledge / expertise in own area and participate in knowledge transfer within the team and business unit
  • Keep current on emerging trends/ developments and grow knowledge of the business, related tools and techniques
  • Participate in personal performance management and development activities, including cross training within own team
  • Keep others informed and up-to-date about the status / progress of projects and / or all relevant or useful information related to day-to-day activities
  • Contribute to the success of the team by willingly assisting others in the completion and performance of work activities; provide training, coaching and/or guidance as appropriate.
  • Contribute to a fair, positive and equitable environment that supports a diverse workforce
  • Act as a brand champion for your business area/function and the bank, both internally and/or externally
  • Participate in knowledge transfer within the team and other business units, including participation in cross-functional groups or committees

Requirements

BREADTH & DEPTH

  • Experienced working professional role providing specialized business application management activities, advisory or process / program support within own area of sociality
  • Advanced knowledge of applications supported by the team including system components, functionality, interfaces, data flows, and business rules
  • Knowledge of bank’s PDLC methodology, business testing and project management
  • Requires experienced, conceptual and practical knowledge within their own specialty and knowledge of broader related areas
  • Advanced understanding of business / functional drivers and processes supported for own area
  • Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate with various business partners to explain complex technical issues with a business lens in easily understandable terms
  • Leads projects or work streams within broader projects with moderate risk and complexity, may be accountable for ongoing activities, processes and functional programs
  • Exercises judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information
  • Work performed under minimal management guidance and supervision
  • Identify and lead problem resolutions
  • Generally reports to a Manager or Senior Manager

EXPERIENCE & EDUCATION

  • Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
  • 3+ years relevant experience
  • Strong knowledge of Workday, specifically organizations and associated business processes
  • Advanced MS Office, specifically Excel
  • Knowledge of SQL
  • Bilingual (English / French) would be an asset #LI-Hybrid

Hours

37.5

Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: First Nations/Métis/Inuit Candidates - Personal & Business Banking Development Program
description:
Address:

100 King Street West

Job Family Group:

Data Analytics & Reporting

We invite all experienced and aspiring First Nations / Métis / Inuit professionals to apply to roles featured on BMO’s Indigenous Careers landing page, as well as all of those on BMO\'s Careers page.

Qualified First Nations / Métis / Inuit applicants applying through these postings will be considered for open job vacancies, where they exist, or added to our Indigenous Talent Network and matched to other upcoming opportunities.

This is part of BMO’s ongoing commitment to Indigenous applicants. Our recruitment team will reach out to those selected for further consideration.

Are you analytically inclined, digitally-savvy and motivated by the opportunity to innovate and deliver cutting edge products & solutions in Canada?

At BMO, we’re looking to change the way Canadians bank and you’ll get to drive that change – helping customers make real financial progress across the country. At the heart of this change in Canadian banking is product innovation, data & analytics, and superior risk management – as such, we’re excited to offer a 2-year rotational program designed to accelerate knowledge and personal development by building solid and in-depth understanding of how our Product, Data & Analytics, Risk and Collections business segments operate and interact to deliver results.  

Product Management: visualize, develop and improve products and services that form our customer offerings and overall experience; help BMO customers make real financial progress by offering differentiated product strategies, value propositions and marketing offers.

Risk Management: Shape BMO’s Risk Appetite and develop lending strategies and controls to optimize returns within that Risk appetite

Data & Analytics: Use Data & Analytics to drive insights and decision-making in partnership with the business and in pursuit of our collective strategic priorities

Collections: Enable and transform customer experience through usage of data and analytics and modeling techniques. Enhance strategic services provided to customers through end-to-end operations functions.

Our capabilities and culture have been featured in Forrester, Forbes and at MIT – Product, Risk and Data & Analytics are regular topics at the BMO CEO’s leadership table.

The successful candidates in the “Personal and Business Banking Development Program” will be part of a 2-year cohort, working alongside banking product, analytics, and risk leaders to accelerate their knowledge, understanding and skills in how BMO’s largest business segment - Personal and Business Banking (P&BB) operates and interacts.

Key Accountabilities:

Support development and implementation of product strategies to drive sales of existing banking products, launch new products to market, optimize profitability and improve the customer experience.

Support management of product risks to ensure compliance with legal, regulatory, and risk compliance, and reporting.

Leverage strong analytical, problem-solving and communication skills to contribute value and grow a network across multiple roles and functions in Canadian Personal & Business Banking, including the Data & Analytics Centre of Excellence, Product Management, Risk Management and Collections.

Help plan and deploy data & analytics solutions to improve issue understanding, generate insights and enable high-quality, fact-based decisions that drive better business outcomes. 

Support the development and execution of various data & analytics-related strategies and roadmaps, including data quality and data analytics, reporting, business intelligence, modeling and the design and development of decision support tools.

Job Requirements:

· Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.

· Leads/participates in the design, implementation, and management of new analytics & reporting solutions.

· Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.

· Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders to deliver on business objectives.

· Analyzes data and information to provide subject-matter insights and recommendations.

· Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business.

· Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions.

· Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.

· Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide subject matter insights and recommendations.

· Structures and assembles data into multi-dimensions with various granularities (e.g., demographics, customers, products, transactions).

· Monitors and tracks tool performance, user acceptance testing, and addresses any issues.

· Integrates information from multiple sources to enable more efficient processes, enhanced analysis and/or streamlined reporting.

· Builds reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences e.g. visualization solutions of data into reports, graphics, dashboards to illustrate facts, trends, and insights.

· Supports development and execution of strategic analytics & reporting initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.

· Documents and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes.

· Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.

· Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.

· Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.

· Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.

· Continuously improves processes to identify issues and deliver optimal customer experience.

· Works with partners to develop salesforce training and materials and manages change.

· Identifies existing and potential risks and develops risk management controls and processes

· May support the sales team in development of client deals and related presentations.

· Develops and maintains relationships with external partners and vendors.

· Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.

Qualifications:

· Graduate or Undergraduate degree in Business/Commerce, Data & Analytics, Risk Management, Economics, Engineering, Finance and/or Mathematics

· Work experience – including Coop and/or Internship placements – Highly Recommended

· Technical proficiency gained through business and work experience – Highly Recommended

· Knowledge and experience in data preparation and data analysis – Strong

· Familiar with one or more industry leading data and analytics tool sets including, but not limited to MS Power BI, TIBCO BPM, Spotfire, Tableau, SQL, SAS, R, Python, MATLAB, SPSS – Good.

· Building business cases – Good

· Researching market trends – Good

· Verbal & written communication skills – In-depth.

· Collaboration & team skills – In-depth.

· Analytical and problem-solving skills, data driven decision making – In-depth.

· Influence skills - In-depth.

We’re here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

title: Senior Manager, AML/ATF Models and Analytics
description:
Requisition ID: 169022

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

What you’ll be doing…

As a Senior data engineer in Data Management, AML/ATF Models and Analytics team, you will contribute to build better way to approach all banking systems data for AML/ATF by using your advanced engineering , analytical and communication skills to work with different business partners across whole Scotiabank. This role will be responsible for leading preject work in Data Quality and Data Integrity improvement initiatives for AML/ATF model building and performance enhancement.This role will work close to Data Governece ,technology department as well as AML compliance office to provide guidance and business requirement for ensuring success in the management of the critical data elements used by all AML/ATF models in order to comply with the corporate audit and regulatory standards.

Is this role right for you? In this role you will:

  • Conduct Deep Dive into banking source data , performing data profiling and analysis to determine better dimmensional/Hierarchical data for AML/ATF model and predict data analysis.
  • Lead team to use latest computing technoloy to deliver end to end applications that raise the bar on AML analytic innovation and quality.
  • Hands-on ownership architecting and developing highly scalable and hight available data mart in Cloud. Google Cloud platform or Microsoft Azure platform
  • Design business intellegence appliaction in either Google cloud BI tool or Microsoft Power BI premium capacity.
  • Act as a subject matter expert for AML/ATF initiatives, working with project senior leadership providing an understanding of the increased risk of AML/ATF associated with implementation of the initiative and developing FIU business requirements to mitigate these risks.
  • Provide data expertise and identify data patterns within banking data to help identify different types of AML risks.
  • Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge
  • Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We’d love to work with you if you have:

  • Strong knowledge of google cloud platform and related components , like big query, looker etc.
  • Strong knowledge of banking products and their data lifecycle
  • Strong effective communication skills and manage expectations with diverse groups for stakeholders
  • Experience programming in such as PySpart, Python, R, SAS. Experience with databases such as Oracle or SQL Server
  • AML/ATF experience or analytic knowledge
  • Data architecture experience in cloud infrastructure
  • Bachelor's degree in business, finance, or engineering
  • Strong experience with data modelling and data analysis
  • Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in AML/ATF

Please note that this is a contract position

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Manager, Campaign Design & Execution
description:
Requisition ID: 174223

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose:

The successful candidate will be part of a dynamic, innovative team that supports the Campaign Design and Execution functions within Scotiabank’s Canadian Bank Analytics group. This individual will develop analytical solutions to help solve a wide array of business problems, including acquisition, migration and engagement strategies across our customer base.

What will you do in this role?

  • Design, build and execute customer marketing offers/communications based on eligibility, analytics, decisioning logic and segmentations to help elevate our customer’s experiences across channels and move to a personalized 1:1 customer journey
  • Apply Next Best Action design principles and build decision strategies using Pega application to execute and monitor marketing offers
  • Document and implement business requirements to deliver key customer interactions across multiple channels
  • Analyze and synthesize data around campaign presentment and customer responses to identify trends, deliver key insights and business recommendations around a customer-first approach to driving acquisition and engagement
  • Act as an analytics generalist and liaison between analytics, technology, quality assurance, business stakeholders and channel partners
  • Provide subject matter expertise on customer contact and support data validation activities
  • Effectively communicate results of highly technical projects to stakeholders and deliver high quality, high impact analytical solutions to business problems

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed?

  • CRM experience working with multiple business partners and delivery timelines
  • Experience with Pega Marketing/Pega Decision Manager/Customer Decision Hub preferred
  • Certified with Pega Decisioning Consultant (PCDC) an asset
  • Experience with targeted leads/campaign execution and segmentation an asset
  • Analytical background with a quantitative focus, such as statistics, applied mathematics, economics, computer science
  • 3-5 years of related experience needed, preferably within a banking or retail industry
  • Experience working with a vast amount of data, relational databases and having strong SQL skills (SQL Server, DB2, MySQL, SAS, etc.)
  • Demonstrated experience developing and delivering marketing communications in a multi-channel marketing environment an asset
  • Self-motivated, strong quantitative skills, attention to detail, a high aptitude for problem solving and a natural interest in understanding customer behavior
  • Past experience in the financial sector or campaign analytics an asset.


Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.
