title: Software Engineer  ML Engine (Layer 6)
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

Layer 6 is a leading Canadian machine learning applied research company, a fully owned subsidiary of TD Bank Group. Layer 6 develops advanced machine learning and deep learning systems that have the power to uplift large populations while advancing the field of artificial intelligence. Our research is supported by access to massive datasets, close collaboration with world renowned academic faculty, and a uniquely scalable machine learning platform.

Our technical capabilities have been publicly recognized through a number of wins in various international machine learning competitions, including the prestigious ACM RecSys Challenge (the only repeat winner in 2017 and 2018 and runner-up in 2019), Google’s Landmark Retrieval Challenge (2nd place in 2018, 3rd place in 2019), the Stanford Question Answering Dataset (2nd place in 2019), 3rd YouTube-8M Video Understanding Challenge (winner in 2019) and Open Images 2019 – Visual Relationship (winner in 2019).

Job Description

The goal of the ML Engine team is to enable training and deploying robust and high-performing models by providing a solid foundation and allowing for fast iteration. We are looking for world-class engineers to take on the challenging problem of shipping core machine learning engine from 0 to 1. This Engine which will be used across the Bank. You will work with ML Product Engineers, Ops teams, and Research Scientist to ensure our framework can support use cases deployed on our computing infrastructure.

What are your main responsibilities?

  • Own and ship product features that enable ML engine capabilities
  • Work with product owners and tech leads to design, ship, and refine significant components of the product.
  • Work with research scientists and MLOps team to maintain service product.

Requirements

Must-Have:

  • Experience with building and scaling data-intensive software.
  • You value good software design and sweat over details in code and API design.
  • You enjoy learning new technology and also educating others.
  • You take great personal pride in building robust and scalable software.
  • You strive to communicate clearly and with empathy.
  • You are highly accountable and have a strong sense of ownership.
  • Ability to do detailed code reviews and give thoughtful feedback.

Nice to have

Experience building a library or a framework.
Experience with Big Data technologies and frameworks including but not limited to Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark, Cassandra, Kafka, Elasticsearch
Comfortable with statistics.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms.
Knowledge of distributed systems.

Additional Information

#LI-Hybrid

Hours

37.5

Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Senior Manager, Data Analytics & Reporting (FRC group)
description:
Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data.

The Business Intelligence group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization.

This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise.

Joining us in Business Intelligence & Reporting is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before.

Job Description

Senior Manager, Data Analytics & Reporting, Finance Risk Controls will be responsible for executing the detailed analytical work related to production of oversight and governance reporting, running monthly/quarterly completeness checks and managing dashboards within TD’s data environment and suite of tools (e.g., HIVE, PySpark, Tableau). The individual will support the team in strengthening of internal controls and enhancing governance and Quality Check (QC) program for financial controls across the Bank. The individual will support the team(s) in ensuring compliance with Finance policies and effectiveness of controls related to financial reporting.

Specific Functions and Accountabilities

  • Managing end-to-end production of reports and dashboards supporting FRC in its mandate of oversight certain Finance policies and financial reporting controls
  • Executing data pipeline and performing data engineering tasks using big data processing tools like HIVE, PySpark
  • Performing bug fixes and updating existing business logic based on business feedback.
  • Creating new metrics/tables and integrating them into the data pipeline on an ongoing basis
  • Running any manual processes to support production of dashboards, e.g., preparing files for data ingestion into TD’s analytics environment
  • Understanding metrics and validating those metrics with business partners, validating data quality for key performance metrics and performing root-cause analysis for any discrepancies noted, in alignment with relevant business partners
  • Gathering requirements for creation of new metrics and reports for dashboards arising from evolving needs
  • Collaborating with business partners in sourcing and maintaining reports and dashboard
  • Leading review and walkthrough sessions with various business and technology partners
  • Maintaining, prioritizing and implementing a feature backlog based on user feedback
  • Enhancements of reporting and dashboard design to optimize dashboard performance
  • Supporting management supervision and review, ongoing training needs, and change management.
  • Supporting dashboard user access management
  • Documenting and setting up of operating procedures to support dashboard implementation e.g., data lineage, metric formulation, data modelling, use cases, etc.
  • Preparing ad hoc reports and presentations, as required

Requirements

Specific Educational and Professional Experience Requirements:

  • University degree in business analytics or other relevant fields
  • 5+ years experience in data analytics, reporting and business intelligence roles
  • Strong knowledge of big data processing tools like, Hive and HQL/SQL, Python and PySpark to extract and transform data
  • Advance working knowledge of MS Excel, VBA and PowerPoint is highly preferred
  • Experience in an accounting/finance role (financial services industry desirable)
  • Internal controls experience will be an asset
  • Familiarity with TD businesses, technology, finance and data ecosystem will be an asset
  • Financial reporting, process, operations, internal controls, audit experiences will be an asset
Professional Skills and Competencies Requirements:

  • Excellent problem-solving skillsets with ability to interpret new business requirements, undertake deep-dive analysis and translate findings into actionable data insights
  • Ability to work with numbers, large data sets and their interpretation for business impact
  • Ability to make recommendations based on a combination of data, professional judgment and common sense
  • Ability to navigate some level of ambiguity and execute
  • Ability to synthesize data, extract meaning and utilize relevant information to identify opportunities and provide recommendations
  • Effective communication skills (both written and verbal), organizational and time-management skills
  • Good understanding of financial statement assertions and their practical application in controls

Additional Information

37.5

We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Developer, Data Science
description:
Req Id: 409144

At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we’re revolutionizing how Canadians communicate.

If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values bold ideas, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.

About Us:
The Data Engineering & Artificial Intelligence focuses largely on sourcing data, maintaining and developing machine learning models and deploying production model driven applications. Our team partners closely with other teams within the company and works most closely with Field Services, operationalizing machine learning to help us continue to transform the business.

If you’re the type of person that has a strong sense of curiosity and is energized by solving complex puzzles, then this role it the perfect opportunity for you. With nearly limitless sources of data at your fingertips, the Data Engineering and Artificial Intelligence team collects and examines millions of data points on network and product performances to optimize resource utilization across a workforce of nearly 10,000 people. The team’s findings help prioritize key technology investments and ensures major corporate decisions are always data driven. This is a terrific opportunity to gain experience working with new cutting-edge technologies.

Position Summary:
Reporting to the Senior Manager, Artificial Intelligence, the ideal candidate is a Developer, Data Science, tasked with the successful planning, design and development of Machine Learning models that help Bell deliver a best in class customer experience. The successful candidate will work closely with cross-functional teams across Bell to implement and operationalize machine learning models that give real-time feedback to our customers and technicians.

Key Responsibilities:
• Build code and models to translate data into actionable insights
• Design and develop Machine Learning models to improve Customer Experience and optimize processes
• Track model performance using appropriate KPIs, metrics and techniques
• Deliver solutions with measurable results and benefits to the business overall and define key metrics for measuring success of the project
• Communicate results of analysis and models to stakeholders effectively and confidently
• Translating business imperatives into data centered questions to be able to quantify and evaluate them
• Bring in new sources of data by exploring data across Bell and externally
• Design and expand interactive dashboards

Qualifications:
• Currently enrolled or recently completed undergraduate or masters degree in Currently enrolled or recently completed undergraduate or masters degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Operations Management/Research, Business or relevant field
• Self starter with excellent problem solving skills
• Experience in using Python and SQL (GCP BigQuery, Microsoft SQL Server, Teradata, SAS, Oracle) to assess data and gather valuable insights
• Experience in developing and modifying GCP (BigQuery, DataFlow, pubsub), Python and SQL ETL Processes
• Experience deploying ML/AI models into production
• Knowledge of machine learning practices and experience applying them to real datasets
• Must be versatile and quick to learn new languages, packages and frameworks
• Judicious and creative thinker who is exceptionally adept with quantitative and qualitative analysis
• Ability to leverage insights and opportunities from data and metrics to build strategies and make recommendations
• Team player with excellent organization and people skills

  • Baccalauréat ou maîtrise dans une discipline comme les mathématiques, les statistiques, l’apprentissage automatique, l’analytique d’affaires, l’informatique décisionnelle, l’informatique ou une discipline connexe.
  • Algorithmes
    • Connaissance approfondie des modèles d’apprentissage automatique : apprentissage profond, apprentissage de renforcement, traitement du langage naturel, etc.
    • Expérience et expertise pratiques avec différents cadres d’intelligence artificielle et d’apprentissage automatique, comme Keras, Pytorch, TensorFlow, SparkML, et Scikit-Learn.
    • Se tenir au fait des nouvelles technologies et techniques dans le secteur de l’apprentissage automatique et de l’intelligence artificielle.
  • Programmation
    • Compétences avancées en développement avec Python
    • Expérience d’autres langages de programmation comme Scala, C, C++, Java, et Shell
    • Excellente conception de code (programmation orientée objet, algorithmes et structures de données)
    • Expérience des pipelines d’intégration et de déploiement continus
  • Données
    • Compréhension des bases de données SGBDR, distribuées et NoSQL
    • Maîtrise de SQL
    • Compréhension de Spark et de MapReduce
  • Facilité d’apprentissage et capacité de sortir des sentiers battus
  • Promoteur de changement : agilité et capacité de mobiliser les ressources et de mener à bien les initiatives clés nécessaires pour la transformation de nos activités.

title: Senior Data Scientist - Revenue Acceleration, Recommendation
description:
About the role

The Revenue Acceleration Data Science team drives Shopify’s go-to-market machine with data and insights. The team’s mission is to increase Shopify’s revenue and profitability and the team\'s impact is grounded in experiment-based findings.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will use elements of analytics, machine learning, experimentation, and build data products to increase Shopify’s revenue and profitability.

title: Data Engineer
location: Mississauga, ON L4Y1M4, CAN Mississauga, ON L4Y1M4, CAN
description:
Job Details

Description

Connect with us LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter

EllisDon is committed to being the safest general contractor. As part of our vaccine directive, we require employees to be fully vaccinated, or in the process of receiving the vaccine against COVID-19. Should you have any additional questions related to our vaccine directive as you move forward in the hiring process, please discuss this with our People & Culture team.

Thinking about a change?

We recognize that the construction industry is changing at a rapid pace and we continually strive to be at the forefront. Our core values empower people to deliver great careers and develop creative solutions for complex problems on some of the most intricate projects. It doesn’t matter what your expertise and craft is – there are no boundaries. We are a group of leading professionals with a variety of expertise: engineers, investment bankers, superintendents, estimators, software engineers, accountants, lawyers, marketing and communications consultants, sustainability professionals, and project managers. As you can see, we are a diverse bunch.

In case you’re curious, here’s what the industry thinks of us and some cool things we have done.

You as a Data Engineer (Insight and Analytics) will:

  • Be a technical lead in the development of high-volume platforms & Data pipelines
  • Work with relevant stakeholders to identify sources of data and map out processes/data flow while researching opportunities for data acquisition and innovative new uses for existing data.
  • Design, construct, install, test, and maintain highly scalable data management systems while integrating new data management technologies into existing structures.
  • Develop ETL processes to move internal and external data into EllisDon's external cloud-based data lake: Develop separate ETL processes to move data from data lake to data warehouse(s).
  • Provide input and feedback to support continuous improvement in team processes

  • Providing thought leadership for all data solutions, including designing data solutions that meet and exceed customer expectations.

  • Continually improve our data pipelines and find innovative ways to maximize automation while recommending ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality.

Is this the right role for you?

  • Have knowledge and understanding of Programming Languages: Python and/or Java, SQL, ETL methodologies and toolsets, AWS/Google ecosystem, Database design, MS SQL, MySQL and/or Redshift/Big Query and NoSQL
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and collaborative environment

EllisDon is proud to provide this unique career opportunity within a progressive environment with continuous learning and opportunity for growth, as well as a competitive compensation package.

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it!

We are an equal opportunity employer. While only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview, be sure to continually check our website for other related positions as they are posted.

title: Expert Data Developer
description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Expert, Data Developer is responsible for building, handling, and optimizing data pipelines. The role moves them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers, shapes the enterprise Data as a Service (DaaS) model and delivers on Information and Technology (I&T) business models. The incumbent develops best practices and optimizes data pipelines to deliver products and services aligned with business expectations. Moreover, the position plays a pivotal role in operationalizing data and analytics initiatives, defining and building CN’s data integration and DaaS platform roadmap.

Main Responsibilities

Data Development

· Ensure optimal data delivery architecture and processes are consistent throughout ongoing projects

· Optimize CN’s data architecture to support the next generation of products and data initiatives

· Build, handle, and optimize data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers

· Build data and domain event models, implement business rules, and scalable data pipelines

· Ensure compliance with data governance and security requirements while creating, improving, and operationalizing integrated and reusable data pipelines

· Enable faster data access, integrate data reuse, and improve time-to-solution for data and analytics initiatives

· Integrate analytics and data science results with business processes

· Promote effective data management practices

· Collaborate with Data Science, Reporting, Analytics, and other Development teams to build data pipelines, infrastructure, and tooling to support business initiatives

· Oversee the design and maintenance of data pipelines and contribute to the continual enhancement of the data development architecture

· Collaborate with the team to meet performance, scalability, and reliability goals

· Maintain and expand existing systems, tooling, and infrastructure

· Design and develop Exact, Transfer and Load (ETL) pipelines using multiple sources of data in various formats and deploy them to achieve a high-level of reliability, scalability, and security

Data Design

· Collaborate with stakeholders and architects to model data landscape and define secure data exchange approaches

· Meet with stakeholders to identify fit-for-purpose within CN’s existing data ecosystem and deliver options and agile solutions

· Design and develop processing pipelines that ingest data into the Data Platforms

· Expose the data into meaningful formats so that it can be easily consumed

· Provide day-to-day support and technical expertise to both technical and
non-technical teams

· Participate in building data development expertise and framework

· Translate business needs into technical requirements

Data Operations and Quality Assurance

· Use Agile methodologies and development practices to streamline project delivery aligned with goals, timelines, and budgets and for code reviews and testing to develop and deliver data pipelines

· Build monitoring and debugging tools to analyze data pipelines

· Help unify software development and operations seamlessly, efficiently, and cost effectively

· Improve software quality, automate processes, and accelerate software releases

· Develop and implement test plans and scripts for various data quality processes

· Maintain manual and automated test scripts

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday and is eligible to participate in CN’s flexible work from home policy. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress.

Requirements

Experience

Data Development

· Minimum 10 years of overall work experience

· Minimum 5 years demonstrating technical leadership qualities or overseeing deliverables

· Minimum 7 years of experience in a data development role, working in different data management disciplines including data integration, modelling, optimization and quality

o Experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with business stakeholders in support of a departmental or multi-departmental data management and analytics initiative

Education/Certification/Designation

· Bachelor\'s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Development or Software Development

· Master’s Degree or Doctor of Philosophy in Data Management, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related quantitative field*

· Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) Degree*

· Google or Azure Data Development certification*

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

Competencies

· Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing

· Applies analytical thinking

· Innovates through problem solving

· Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work

· Demonstrates organizational abilities

· Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity

· Works independently with little supervision

Technical Skills/Knowledge

· Knowledge of Scala, Java or Python

· Knowledge of software development best practices such as code reviews, testing frameworks, maintainability, and readability

· Knowledge of Big Data technologies and cloud platforms such as Databricks, Apache Spark, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Explorer, Azure Data Lake, Google BigQuery, Google Dataproc, Google Cloud Data Fusion, Google Dataflow, Google Cloud Composer, Google, Dataprep, Google Dataplex, Google BigLake, Google Vertex

· Knowledge of event-driven architecture (e.g., Pub-Sub, Kafka, Message Queuing (MQ), Message Queuing Telemetry Transport (MQTT), Advanced Message Queuing Protocol (AMQP), Event Hub, Logstash)

· Knowledge of Linux and shell scripting

· Knowledge of multiple database technologies such as Distributed Processing (i.e., Spark, Hadoop), traditional Rational Database Management Systems (RDBMS) (i.e., Oracle, Database 2 (DB2), PostgreSQL), Non-Structured Query Language (NoSQL) (i.e., MongoDB, FireBase)

· Knowledge of Development Operations (DevOps) and Azure DevOps for Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD) Data Pipelines



About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee\'s experience.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

title: Expert Solution Design (Data engineering)
description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Expert Solution Design is responsible for building, managing, and optimizing data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers, shaping the enterprise Data as a Service (DaaS) model and delivering on IT business models. The Expert Solution Design develops best practices and optimizes data pipelines to deliver products and services aligned with business expectations. The incumbent plays a pivotal role in operationalizing data and analytics initiatives, defining and building CN’s data integration and DaaS platform roadmap.

Main Responsibilities

Data Engineering

· Ensure optimal data delivery architecture and processes are consistent throughout ongoing projects

· Optimize CN’s data architecture to support the next generation of products and data initiatives

· Build, manage, and optimize data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers such as business or data analysts and data scientists

· Build data and domain event models, implement business rules, and engineer scalable data pipelines

· Ensure compliance with data governance and security requirements while creating, improving and operationalizing integrated and reusable data pipelines

· Enable faster data access, integrate data reuse, and improve time-to-solution for data and analytics initiatives

· Promote effective data management practices

Data Design

· Collaborate with stakeholders and architects to model data landscape and define secure data exchange approaches

· Meet with stakeholders to identify fit-for-purpose within CN’s existing data ecosystem and deliver options and agile solutions

· Design and develop processing pipelines that ingest data into Data Hubs

· Expose the data into meaningful formats, like GraphQL

· Provide day-to-day support and technical expertise to both technical and non-technical teams

· Participate in building data engineering expertise and framework

· Translate business needs into technical requirements

Data Development

· Acquire, ingest and process data from multiple sources and systems

· Design and develop Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) pipelines using multiple sources of data in various formats

· Produce well documented quality codes

Data Operations - 10%

· Build monitoring and debugging tools to analyze data pipelines

· Help unify software development and operations seamlessly, efficiently, and cost effectively

Data Quality Assurance

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday and offers remote work.

Requirements

Experience

Data Engineering

· Experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with business stakeholders in support of a departmental or multi-departmental data management and analytics initiative

· Experience with at least 2 of the following technologies: Python, Scala, SQL, Java

· Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Spark, etc.

· Experience with Cloud and non-Cloud based Hadoop ecosystem

· Experience with Cloud platforms such as Azure, Google Platform or Databricks

· Experience with traditional data warehousing and ETL tools (Informatica, Talend, Pentaho, DataStage)

· Experience with Linux and shell scripting

· Experience deploying applications into production environments such as code packaging, integration testing, monitoring and release management

· Experience with multiple database technologies such as Distributed Processing (Spark, Hadoop, EMR), traditional RDBMS (MS SQL Server, Oracle, DB2, MySQL, PostgreSQL), NoSQL (MongoDB, DynamoDB, Cassandra)

· Experience working in an Agile team environment

Education/Certification/Designation

· Bachelor\'s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Software Engineering

· Master’s Degree or PhD in Data Management, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related quantitative field*

· Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) Degree*

· Google or Azure Data Engineering certification*

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

Competencies

· Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing

· Ability to communicate complex solutions

· Applies analytical thinking

· Innovates through problem solving

· Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work

· Demonstrates organizational abilities and detail oriented

· Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity

· Works independently with little supervision

· Applies agile mindset

· Ability to work across structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data, extracting information and identifying linkages across disparate data sets

· Demonstrates commitment to high standards of ethics, regulatory compliance, customer service, and business integrity

Technical Skills/Knowledge

· Strong data analytics and development skills

· Demonstrated creativity skills

· Expertise in a combination of Scala, Java or Python

· Expertise with Big Data architecture and distributed computing processes and platforms such as Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Kafka, etc.

· Expertise with one or more SQL-on-Hadoop technology (Hive, Impala, Spark SQL, Presto)

· Knowledge of software engineering best practices such as code reviews, testing frameworks, maintainability and readability

· Expertise with GraphQL*

*Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. title: Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance
description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance contributes to the SAP ecosystem roadmap by planning, executing and providing expertise on data-related activities. The role is instrumental as CN is currently undertaking a large multi-year business transformation program triggered by a SAP ECC to a SAP S/4 HANA product migration.

The incumbent works within a multi-disciplinary team and participates in a variety of data activities, namely: profiling, quality assessment and cleansing of master and transactional data objects, including establishment of data cleansing strategies and their implementation; master data mapping, transformation and enrichment, to account for new SAP product data models and business transformation requirements; and data governance and management tasks on approval workflows, configurations and processes to ensure data objects maintain compliance to CN quality standards throughout their lifecycle.

The incumbent contributes to data validation runs, troubleshooting, data reconciliation and identification of corrective actions prior to production migrations.

The position helps develop skills and experience in setting up and managing best-in-class data pipelines that are becoming essential building block in industries adopting data-centric digital transformation approaches.

Main Responsibilities

Data Profiling and Cleansing – Data-Related Tasks on the “As-Is” Environment – 30%

Participates in data objects identification and business rules profiling

Performs data quality assessment and quality metrics reporting

Participates in manual/automated data object cleansing strategies and their implementation

Collaborates to the iterative post-cleansing validation and implementation of corrective measures

Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools to carry out tasks

Data Mapping and Transformation - Data-Related Tasks on the “To-Be” Environment – 40%

Participates in identification and design of functional data mapping, transformation and enrichment activities and documentation according to the business process re-engineering efforts and new S/4 HANA data structures

Implements sandbox solutions to assess data mapping and transformation methods, including algorithms

Performs iterative validation runs and implement corrective measures on conversions

Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools and conversion platforms to carry out tasks

Data Governance and Management - Data-Related Tasks on the Data Lifecycle and Enhancements – 30%

Identifies, implements, and validates governance workflow and data business rules requirements for master data management, in conjunction with business owners

Takes part in data quality assessment on target systems

Implements data governance roadmap and strategy on specialized data management tools and platforms

Participates in functional designs and documentation, system configuration, and validation

Maps enterprise-level data governance requirements into SAP landscape

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress.

Requirements

Experience

Managing and Handling Enterprise Data

Between 1 to 3 years of experience in managing and handling enterprise data

Education/Certification/Designation

Bachelor’s Degree in a technical or business field, with an interest in data management

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science or Engineering*

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

Competencies

Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing

Applies analytical thinking

Innovates through problem solving

Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work

Demonstrates organizational abilities

Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity

Works independently with little supervision

Technical Skills/Knowledge

Strong interest in managing and validating data, understanding its attributes, characteristics and business value.

Hands-on experience in planning and executing general Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) data tasks*

Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, in particular SAP (SAP ECC, SAP S/4 HANA)*

Strong interest in business processes and the way data interrelates to those processes

Interest in exploring data, performing investigation and analysis, and applying resolution and validation in complex data sets

Knowledge of Excel or equivalent productivity tools

Ability and interest in developing advanced user knowledge of specialized data management platforms and tools such as Syniti Advanced Data Migration (ADM), SAP Master Data Governance (MDG), SAP Utopia, SAP Asset Information Workbench (AIW)

Ability to present and communicate results clearly

Knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL) statements and scripting, including SQL Server Management Studio*

*Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset

Organizational Impact

Decision Making & Impacts

The position performs data-centric tasks that are foundational to the SAP ecosystem roadmap and lifecycle

Level of Interaction/Influence

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance interacts with business and Information and Technology (I&T) data experts, Coordinators, Data Technology Specialists, Solution Architects, enterprise-level data governance teams, as well as working closely with their business and functional counterparts in Finance, Procurement, Supply Management, Mechanical and Engineering organizations.

Employees Supervised/Organizational Structure

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance reports to the Senior Manager, SAP S/4 HANA Transformation, Data Governance and Migration, Information and Technology. The role has no supervisory responsibilities.

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship.
